Ingredients: Chicken wings with skin  6   Oil   to deep fry Salt   to taste Black peppercorns , crushed  to taste Smoked paprika  1 teaspoon Garlic powder  1/2 teaspoon Onion powder  1/2 teaspoon Lemon juice  1 teaspoon Refined flour (maida)  1 cup Rice flour  1/2 cup Fresh parsley leves , chopped  to garnish Barbecue sauce     Butter  1 tablespoon Tomato ketchup  1/2 cup Worcestershire sauce  1 tablespoon Onion powder  1/2 teaspoon Garlic powder  1/2 teaspoon Black peppercorns , crushed  to taste English mustard paste  1 teaspoon Brown sugar  1 1/2 teaspoons Tabasco sauce  1 teaspoon Chicken stock  4-5 tablespoons Smoked paprika  1/2 teaspoon
Method: ['To prepare barbecue sauce, heat 1 tablespoon butter in a non-stick pan. Add tomato ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, onion powder, garlic powder, crushed peppercorns, English mustard paste, 1 teaspoon brown sugar and Tabasco sauce, mix and simmer for 1 minute. ', 'Add 2-3 tablespoons chicken stock and mix well. Add paprika, remaining brown sugar and remaining chicken stock, mix and cook on low heat for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat.', 'Take chicken wings in a bowl. Add salt, crushed peppercorns, Â½ teaspoon paprika, garlic powder, onion powder and lemon juice and rub in well. Set aside to marinate for 15-20 minutes.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. ', 'Mix together refined flour, rice flour, remaining paprika and salt on a plate. ', 'Coat the marinated chicken wings with the flour mixture. Slide the chicken wings into hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper. ', 'Add fried chicken wings to the barbecue sauce and mix well. Place the pan back on heat and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Arrange the chicken wings on a serving platter and serve hot garnished with parsley. ']

Ingredients: Tomato ketchup  3/4 cup Butter  1 tablespoon Garlic , finely chopped 1  tablespoon Red chilli paste  3 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce  1 tablespoon Salt   to taste Garlic powder  2 teaspoons Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Onion powder  1 teaspoon Mustard powder  1 teaspoon Black pepper powder   to taste Brown sugar  1 tablespoon Vinegar  2-3 tablespoons Boneless chicken breast , with criss cross slits on one side 1
Method: ['Heat butter in a non-stick pan. Add garlic, and sautÃ© till raw smells disappear. Add tomato ketchup and mix well. Add red chilli paste and Worcestershire sauce and mix well. ', 'When the mixture begins to boil, add salt, garlic powder, red chilli powder, onion powder, mustard powder and black pepper and mix well. Add brown sugar and Â¼ cup water and mix well. When the mixture begins to boil, add vinegar, mix well and simmer for 15-20 minutes. ', 'Remove from heat and transfer into a bowl. ', 'To use, place a chicken breast on a baking tray. Apply the barbeque sauce on both sides, keep the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 10 minutes at 180Â° C. ', 'Bring the tray out of the oven, transfer the chicken breast onto a serving plate and serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Peanuts  2 cups Oil  2 teaspoons Sea salt   to taste Honey  1 tablespoon White bread toasted  slices
Method: ['Preheat oven to 180Â° C.', 'Spread peanuts on a baking tray and roast in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes.', 'Remove the tray from the oven, transfer the peanuts into a mixer jar and grind to a\npaste.', 'Add oil, salt and honey and grind again to a smooth paste.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl. Spread over toasted bread slices and serve.']

Ingredients: Mayonnaise  3 tablespoons Garlic , finely chopped 1 tablespoon Tomato ketchup  2 tablespoons White onion , finely chopped 2 tablespoons Salt   to taste Black pepper powder   to taste Tabasco   a few drops Iceberg lettuce leaves  8-16   Romaine lettuce leaves  4-8   Egg , hard boiled and quartered vertically 1   Prawns , blanched 8   Parsley sprigs  a few to garnish
Method: ['To prepare thousand island dressing, take mayonnaise in a bowl, add garlic, tomato ketchup, white onions, salt, black pepper powder and Tabasco sauce and mix well.', 'Put 1-2 iceberg lettuce leaves in each stemmed glass, top it with 1-2 romaine lettuce leaves and 1-2 iceberg lettuce leaves. Top with the 1-2 tablespoons dressing and a boiled egg quarter. Skew 2 prawns on toothpicks and place them in the glass. Serve immediately.\n', 'Transfer the remaining dressing into a bottle and garnish with a parsley sprig.\n']

Ingredients: Eggs  4   Refined flour  200 grams Yeast  5 grams Castor sugar  1 tablespoon Milk  1/2 cup Egg white  1   Oil   for cooking Hollandaise sauce   For topping Black peppercorns crushed  to taste Paprika   to sprinkle Fresh parsley chopped  to sprinkle
Method: ['To make English muffins, put yeast in a bowl. Add sugar and milk and mix well.', 'Add flour and mix. Add egg white, mix and knead into a soft dough. Set aside till the dough doubles in volume. ', 'Divide the dough into 4 equal portions and roll out into balls. Dust the balls with dry flour and pat into thick discs with your fingers. ', 'Heat some oil on a non-stick tawa. Place the discs on it and cook, turning sides, for 7-8 minutes or till evenly done on both sides. ', 'Heat sufficient water in a non-stick pan. Break eggs, one by one, into it and let them poach. Drain on an absorbent paper. ', 'Place the English muffins on a serving platter. Place a poached egg on each and top with a spoonful of hollandaise sauce. Sprinkle crushed peppercorns, paprika and parsley and serve immediately. ']

Ingredients: Melted chocolate  2 tablespo   Butter paper  130 grams Condensed milk  1/2 cup Vanilla essence  1 teaspoon Refined flour  1 cup Cocoa powder  1/4 cup Baking powder  1/2 teaspoon Milk  1/3 cup Walnuts chopped 10-15 + to sprinkle Chocolate vermicelli   to sprinkle Colourful sprinklers   to sprinkle
Method: ['Preheat oven to 180Â° C. Grease a square baking tin with some butter and dust with some flour. ', 'Take butter in a mixing bowl, add condensed milk and vanilla essence and beat with a hand blender till light. Add melted chocolate and beat again.', 'Sift together flour, cocoa powder and baking powder into the bowl and fold in well. Add milk and mix. Add walnuts and mix well. ', 'Spread the mixture into the prepared tin, tap gently and sprinkle walnuts on top. ', 'Keep the tin in the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes.', 'Remove the tin from the oven, cool and demould. Cut into cubes, place on a wire rack and pour melted chocolate on each. Set aside till the chocolate settles.', 'Sprinkle chocolate vermicelli and colourful sprinklers and serve immediately. ']

Ingredients: Whole green gram (sabut moong) , soaked overnight and drained 1 cup Rice , soaked overnight and drained 2 tablespoons Green chilli  1   Ginger , finely chopped 1 inch   Curry leaves  7-8   Fresh coriander leaves , chopped 2 tablespoons Salt   to taste Oil   to shallow fry Cottage cheese (paneer) , cut into 1/2 inch cubes 100 grams Tomatoes , sliced 2 medium Gun powder (molaga podi)   to sprinkle Tomato ketchup   to serve Coconut chutney   to serve
Method: ['Put green gram in a grinder jar, add rice, green chilli, ginger, curry leaves, coriander leaves and sufficient water and grind to a fine paste.  Transfer into a bowl and set aside for 1 hour.', 'Add salt and mix well.', 'Heat a non-stick pan, drizzle a little oil and spread with muslin cloth. Pour a ladle of batter and spread it evenly. Drizzle some more oil all around.  Flip when the underside is golden and cook the other side till golden brown.  ', 'Place cottage cheese cubes and tomato slices alternately and sprinkle gunpowder over them. Fold and remove the pesarattu from the pan onto a serving plate. Make more pesarattu in the same way.', 'Serve hot with tomato ketchup and coconut chutney.']

Ingredients: Tamarind (imli) pulp  4 tablespoons Cooked rice (cooked with salt and turmeric powder) 3 cups Oil  2  tablespoons Mustard seeds  1/2 teaspoon Split Bengal gram  1 teaspoon Split skinless black gram  1 teaspoon Asafoetida  a large pi   Curry leaves  10-15   Green chillies finely chopped 2   Dried red chillies broken into large pieces 2   Roasted peanuts crushed 1/2 cup Roasted sesame seeds  1 teaspoon Salt   to taste
Method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds, split black gram and Bengal gram, mix and sautÃ© till the grams turn golden brown.  Add the asafoetida, curry leaves, green chillies and red chillies, mix and sautÃ© till fragrant.', 'Stir in tamarind pulp and a little water, mix and  cook till the mixture thickens.', 'Add rice, peanuts, sesame seeds and salt and mix gently. ', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Mutton   cubed 500 grams Onion    Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Poppy seeds (khuskhus/posto)  1 teaspoon Fennel seeds (saunf)  1/2 teaspoon Black peppercorns  4   Coriander seeds  1 teaspoon Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Cinnamon  1 inch stick Cloves  2   Green cardamoms  2   Oil  4 tablespoons Curry leaves  10   Onions chopped 3 medium Ginger-garlic paste  1 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Black pepper powder  2 teaspoon Tomato chopped 1 large Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons
Method:
['Pressure cook mutton pieces with two cups of water, salt and turmeric powder for six whistles. Open the lid when the pressure reduces, drain and reserve the cooking liquor.

    Dry roast poppy seeds, fennel seeds, black peppercorns, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, cinnamon, cloves and green cardamoms. Cool and grind to a fine powder. Heat oil in kadai (wok). Add curry leaves and onions. SautÃ© till the onions are brown. Add ginger-garlic paste, red chilli powder and half the black pepper powder and sautÃ© for a minute.



', 'Add tomato and mutton pieces, cook on high heat till the tomato is soft. Add salt and the spice powder and simmer for five minutes.

    Add the reserved cooking liquor and one cup of water and bring to a boil. Simmer till all the mutton pieces get well coated with thick gravy.', 'Add the remaining black pepper powder and stir well. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Chicken cut into 8 pieces on the bone 750 grams Oil  3 tablespoons Bay leaf  1   Cinnamon  1 inches Black cardamom  1   Green cardamoms  2-3   Cloves  4-5   Black peppercorns  6-8   Asafoetida  1/4 teaspoon Mustard seeds  1/2 teaspoon Curry leaves  15-20   Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Medium onion chopped 1   Sesame seeds (til)  1 tablespoon Roasted peanuts  2 tablespoons Dried red chillies  4-5   Poppy seeds (khuskhus) soaked 1 tablespoon Ginger-garlic paste  1 tablespoon Salt   to taste Coriander powder  1 tablespoon Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Coconut milk  2 cups Tamarind paste  1 tablespoon Fresh coriander sprig    to garnish
Method: ['Heat oil in a deep non-stick pan, add bay leaf, cinnamon, black cardamom, green cardamoms, cloves and black peppercorns and saute.', 'Add asafoetida, mustard seeds, curry leaves and Â¼ tsp turmeric powder and let the seeds splutter. Add onion and saute till fragrant.', 'Put sesame seeds, peanuts, dried red chillies, and poppy seeds in a mixer jar and grind with a little water to a fine paste.', 'Add ginger-garlic paste to the pan and saute for 1 minute. Add chicken and mix and sautÃ© on high heat for 2-3 minutes. Add salt and 1 cup water and mix.  Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add coriander powder, red chilli powder and Â¼ tsp turmeric powder and mix.  Add the ground masala and mix. Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes. ', 'Add coconut milk and mix well. Add tamarind paste and mix well. Cover and simmer for 3-4 minutes or till the chicken is fully cooked.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with a fresh coriander sprig and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Cottage cheese (paneer) cut into big cubes 200 grams Dried red chillies soaked 8-10   Garlic cloves  8-10   Ginger roughly chopped 1 inch   Rice  2 tablespoons Salt   to taste Curry leaves  1 sprig   Hung yogurt  1 tablespoon Oil  2 tablespoons Refined flour   for coating Spring onion greens chopped  for garnish Green chutney   to serve
Method: ['Put the soaked dried red chillies, garlic, ginger, rice, salt, curry leaves and a little water and grind to a slightly coarse paste.', 'Take the cottage cheese cubes in a bowl, add the ground paste, salt and hung yogurt and mix well so that all the cottage cheese cubes are well covered. ', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Spread refined flour on a plate, roll the cottage cheese cubes in it and shallow fry, turning sides in the hot oil till they are evenly done on all sides.\n', 'Drain them on absorbent paper.\n', 'Arrange them on a serving platter, garnish with spring onion greens and serve hot with green chutney.']

Ingredients: Raw mangoes cut into cubes 1 kilogram Salt  1 cup + to taste Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Mustard seeds powdered 1 cup Red chilli powder powdered 1 cup Sesame oil  1/2 cup + as required Garlic cloves   as required Fenugreek seeds   as required
Method: ['Put mango cubes in a bowl. Add salt to taste and turmeric powder, mix well and set aside for 5-10 minutes. ', 'Mix together mustard powder, chilli powder and salt in another bowl. Add sesame oil and mix well. Add mango cubes and mix well. ', 'Put a layer of masala mangoes in a glass jar. Top with a layer of some garlic cloves and Â½ teaspoon fenugreek seeds and repeat these layers till all the mangoes are used. Add some sesame oil in between. Cover and keep for 2 days. ', 'Serve. ']

Ingredients: Milk , curdled with 1 tsp citric acid 1 litre   Canned pineapple slices , soaked in water 7-8   Powdered sugar  4 tablespoons Green cardamom powder  1/2 teaspoon Almonds , blanched, peeled and slivered  to garnish Pistachios , blanched, peeled and slivered  to garnish Saffron strands   to garnish
Method: ['Strain the curdled milk (chenna) through a muslin cloth and squeeze out excess water completely.', 'Transfer the chenna onto a large plate and knead lightly. Add powdered sugar and green cardamom powder and knead again.', 'Transfer chenna into a piping bag. ', 'Drain the pineapple slices on an absorbent paper till they are completely dry and place on a serving platter. Pipe out the chenna mixture on the edges of pineapple slices in floral shape.', 'Garnish each slice with almond slivers, pistachio slivers, few saffron strands and serve. ']

Ingredients: Poppy seeds (khuskhus / posto) , soaked 1 cup Milk  2 cups Ghee  1/2 cup Semolina (rawa / suji)  2 tablespoons Walnuts  15-20 + to garnish Caster sugar  1 1/2 cups Mawa , grated 1 1/2 cups Green cardamom powder  1 teaspoon Saffron   a few strands
Method: ['Spoon the soaked poppy seeds into a blender jar, add Â½ cup milk and blend to a fine paste.', 'Heat a non-stick pan, add ghee, poppy seed paste and semolina, mix and sautÃ©, stirring continuously to avoid the formation of lumps, on medium heat for 15-20 minutes, or till the mixture thickens and becomes golden brown. ', 'Crush and add 15-20 walnuts and mix well. Add caster sugar, remaining milk and stir continuously to avoid formation of lumps and cook on medium heat till the mixture thickens and colour changes to brown.', 'Add khoya / mawa and mix well. SautÃ© for a minute and add green cardamom powder, mix and sautÃ© for 2-3 minutes. Switch off heat and add saffron and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and garnish with California walnuts. Allow to cool down. ', 'Serve cold. ']

Ingredients: Orange drink powder  3 tablespoons Milk  2 litres Milk , to make chenna 1 litres Lemon juice  1 1/2 tablespoons Sweet condensed milk  400 grams Sugar  2 tablespoons Almonds , slivered 4-5   Pistachios , slivered 4-5
Method: ['Heat 2 lt milk in a deep non-stick pan till it reduces to half.', 'Heat 1 lt milk in another non-stick pan. ', 'Place a muslin cloth over a strainer kept on a bowl.', 'When the milk in the 2nd pan comes to a boil, add lemon juice and let it curdle. Pour the curdled milk into the strainer and let all whey drain. (Reserve this whey. You can use it to knead chapatti dough or to make chenna again).', 'Gather the edges of the cloth together, dip in cold water kept in another bowl, till it cools down completely. Squeeze the cloth to drain all excess water away.', 'Add condensed milk to the reduced milk and mix well. Cook till it reduces a little more.', 'Place the chenna on the worktop or in a parat and mash it with the heels of your palms. ', 'Add sugar to reduced milk and mix and continue to cook.', 'Take orange drink powder in a small bowl, add Â¼ cup reduced milk and mix well.', 'When the milk reduces to the required consistency, add small portions of mashed chenna and mix well. Cook for 3-4 minutes and take it off the heat. Cool down to room temperature.', 'Add orange powder mixture and mix well and chill.', 'Pour into individual bowls and serve chilled garnished with almonds and pistachios.']

Ingredients: Mutton , cut into 1 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams Mustard oil  3 tablespoons Potatoes , peeled and quartered 2 medium Onion , chopped 1 large Salt   to taste Cumin powder  1 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1 1/2 teaspoons Coriander powder  1 teaspoon Ginger-garlic paste  1 tablespoon Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Green chillies , slit 3   Fresh tomato puree  1 cup Fresh coriander leaves , chopped 1 tablespoon+ for garnish Luchi     Refined flour dough  200 grams Oil  to grease  to deep fry
Method: ['Heat mustard oil in a deep non-stick pan till it smokes, add potatoes and fry till they turn a light brown.', 'Add onion, mix and sautÃ© for a minute. Cover and cook till onion turns golden brown. ', 'Take mutton pieces in a large bowl, add salt, cumin powder, red chilli powder, coriander powder, ginger-garlic paste and turmeric powder, mix well and keep the bowl in the refrigerator to marinate for 1 hour if you have the time.', 'Add the marinated mutton to the pan and mix well.Add green chillies,mix, cover and cook on low heat for 8-10 minutes.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Add tomato puree and mix well. Add salt, cover and cook on low heat for 50-60 minutes or till mutton is fully done.', 'Divide the dough into small portions. Grease a worktop with some oil and roll out each portion into small luchis.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Slide in the luchis, one at a time, and deep-fry till golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Add coriander leaves to the mutton and mix well. ', 'Transfer the mutton into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with luchis. ']

Ingredients: Green peas , blanched and crushed 3/4 cup Refined flour dough   as required Split Bengal gram (chana dal) , soaked and boiled 1 cup Ghee  1 tablespoon Fennel seeds (saunf)  1/2 teaspoon Ginger , finely chopped 1 teaspoon Green chillies , finely chopped 1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Sugar  2 pinches Cloves  4   Cinnamon  1/2 inch stick Bay leaf  1   Cumin seeds  1/4 teaspoon Fresh coconut , chopped 1 tablespoon Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Raisins  12-16   Bengal gram stock  1 1/2  cups Oil  1/2 tablespoon+ for deep frying Dried red chillies , broken 1-2   Green chillies , slit 1-2
Method: ['To make the stuffing, heat Â½ tablespoon ghee in a non-stick pan, add fennel seeds, ginger and green chillies, mix and sautÃ© for 30 seconds.', 'Add green peas, salt and a pinch of sugar, mix and sautÃ© till the moisture dries. Transfer into a bowl and set aside to cool.', 'Heat Â½ tablespoon ghee in the same pan, add cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf, cumin seeds and coconut pieces, mix and sautÃ© till the coconut turns light golden brown. ', 'Add turmeric powder and Bengal gram and mix well. Add a pinch of sugar, salt and raisins and cook for a minute. AddBengal gram stock, mix and bring to a boil. ', 'Heat Â½ tablespoon oil in a small non-stick tempering pan, add dried red chillies and slit green chillies, sautÃ© for 15 seconds and pour over the Bengal gram. Simmer for 4-5 minutes. ', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions and shape them into balls. Flatten each ball slightly and shape them into katoris, stuff each katori with some cooked green peas mixture, bring the edges together and seal taking care that the stuffing is completely covered and shape them into balls.', 'Apply a little oil on each stuffed ball and roll out into small discs. Slide the discs into hot oil and deep-fry in hot oil till golden brown and drain on absorbent paper. ', 'Transfer the dal into a katori and arrange the kochuri on a serving plate and serve them hot.']

Ingredients: Buffalo milk  5 cups Buffalo milk  1 litre Lemon juice  2 tablespoons Sugar  1/4 cup Green cardamom powder  1/4 teaspoon Pistachios , blanched, peeled and sliced 1 tablespoon Almonds , blanched, peeled and sliced 1 tablespoon
Method: ['Boil 5 cups milk in a deep non-stick pan on low heat till it reduces and thickens. ', 'Boil 1 litre milk in another deep non-stick pan. Switch the heat off, add lemon juice and stir till it curdles. ', 'Strain through a muslin cloth kept over a strainer and immediately put the muslin cloth in ice cold water. Squeeze out excess water. ', 'Transfer the chhana on a plate and mash with your hands. ', 'Add sugar and cardamom powder to the reduced milk, mix well and cook till the sugar melts. Add pistachios and almonds, mix and switch off heat. ', 'Scrape off the sides and bottom of the pan and mix with the milk, add chhana and mix well. ', 'Transfer payesh into individual kasore and keep them in a refrigerator to chill.', 'Serve chilled. ']

Ingredients: Jaggery  3/4 cup whole wheat flour  2 cups dry coconut grated 1/2 cup fennel eeds  1 teaspoon green cardamom powder  1/4 teaspoon ghee  2 tablespoons Oil for deep frying
Method:
['Heat a deep pan, add jaggery and Â½ cup water, mix and cook till jaggery dissolves completely. Take the pan off the heat and set aside to cool to room temperature.
', 'Mix together whole wheat flour, grated dry coconut, fennel seeds, green cardamom powder and ghee in a large plate. Add the jaggery syrup and mix.  Add Â¼ cup water and knead into stiff dough. Cover and set aside for 5 minutes.
', 'To make the thekua, divide the dough into equal portions and give each portion a thick tear drop shape. Make a slight dent in the centre vertically and press with fork prongs on either side of the dent to make a design of a leaf.  
', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai, deep fry the prepared thekuas on medium heat till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
Arrange on a serving plate and serve.
']

Ingredients: Dried white peas soaked overnight, drained and boiled with turmeric 1 cup Mustard oil  1 1/2 tablespoons Asafoetida  1/4 teaspoon Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Medium onion finely chopped 1   Ginger finely chopped 1 tablespoon White peas stock  1/4 cup Medium tomato finely chopped 1   Salt   to taste Coriander powder  1 tablespoon Dried mango powder (amchur)  1 teaspoon Fresh coriander leaves finely chopped 2 tablespoons
Method: ['Heat mustard oil in a non-stick pan, add asafoetida, cumin seeds and onion and sautÃ© till lightly browned. ', 'Add ginger, boiled peas and peas stock and mix well. Add tomato and mix well. ', 'Add little salt and mix again. Add coriander powder and dried mango powder and mix well. Add coriander leaves and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes.  ', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Short grained rice (kolam)  1 cup Split Bengal gram (chana dal)  1 cup Green peas  1/2 cup Ginger chopped 1 inch   Green chillies chopped 1-2   Asafoetida  1 pinch   Salt   to taste Oil   to shallow fry Dal   to serve
Method: ['Put rice in a bowl, add split Bengal gram and sufficient water and wash thoroughly. Soak in sufficient water overnight.', 'Drain and put into a grinder jar, add sufficient water and grind into a smooth paste.', 'Transfer it into a bowl, add green peas, ginger, green chillies, asafoetida, salt and mix well.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a non-stick pan, pour some batter to make small pancakes and cook, turning sides, till both sides are golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot with dal.']

Ingredients: Whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta) kneaded into a dough with ghee, salt and sufficien 2 cups Roasted chana flour (sattu)  1/2 cup Medium onion finely chopped 1  Garlic finely chopped 1 tablespoon Ginger finely chopped 1 teaspoon Green chillies finely chopped 2-3   Carom seeds (ajwain)   1/4 teaspoon Onion seeds (kalonji)  1/4 teaspoon Salt   to taste Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons Red chilli pickle masala  2 teaspoons Mustard oil  1 teaspoon Ghee    to serve
Method: ['Preheat the air-fryer to 180Âº C.', 'To make the stuffing, take sattu in a bowl, add onion, ginger and green chillies in a bowl. Add carom seeds, onion seeds, salt, coriander leaves, red chilli pickle masala and mustard oil and mix well. 2-3 tsps water and mix well. ', 'Divide the dough into equal portions and roll them into balls. Spread each ball in your palm keeping the edges thinner than the centre. Place a little stuffing in the centre of each ball, gather the edges and seal. Roll into balls again. ', 'Place the prepared balls in an air fryer basket, fit it to the air-fryer and bake for 15-20 minutes. ', 'Pour hot ghee over the litti and serve hot with chokha. ']

Ingredients: Large brinjal  1  Medium onions  1 1/2  Garlic cloves  1-2   Green chillies  4-5   Medium potatoes boiled and peeled  2  Salt   to taste Mustard oil   2-3 teaspoons
Method: ['Roast brinjal on direct heat till the brinjal gets cooked and the skin charred. ', 'Finely chop onions, garlic and green chillies. Put potatoes in a bowl and mash with your fingers.  ', 'Peel the roasted brinjal and mash along with the potatoes. ', 'Add onion, garlic, green chillies, salt and mustard oil and mix well. ', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve with litti. ']

Ingredients: Medium prawns shelled and deveined 16-20   Oil  1 tablespoon Garlic chopped 1 tablespoon Medium onions sliced 2   Curry leaves  8-10   Tomato puree  1 cup Salt   to taste Cashewnut paste  2 tablespoons Tamarind pulp  1/2 tablespoon Black peppercorns crushed  to taste Sugar  1 pinches Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1 tablespo to garnish Fresh coconut scraped  to garnish Chettinaad masala     Oil  1/4 cup Cumin seeds  1 tablespoon Black peppercorns  1 1/2 tablespoons Coriander seeds  1/4 cup Fennel seeds  1 tablespoon Black cardamoms  2   Star anise  2   Cloves  4-5   Cinnamon  1 inch Stick Green cardamoms  5   Garlic cloves  10-12   Ginger roughly chopped 1 inches Dried red chillies  5   Medium onions sliced 2   Fresh coconut scraped 1/2 cup Curry leaves  1/4 cup
Method: ['To make the chettinaad masala, heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds, black peppercorns, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, black cardamoms, star anise, cloves, cinnamon, green cardamoms, garlic, ginger, red chillies, onions and coconut. Mix well and sautÃ© for 2-3 minutes. Add curry and sautÃ© for 5-7 minutes. Set aside to cool.', 'Transfer the mixture into a mixer jar, add 1 cup water and grind to a fine paste.   ', 'Heat oil in a non-stick deep pan, add garlic and onions. Mix and sautÃ© till golden brown.  ', 'Add curry leaves, sautÃ© for a minute and add tomato puree. Mix well and cook till the oil separates. ', 'Add half of the ground masala and mix well. Saute for 2-3 minutes. Add Â¼ cup water and mix. Add prawns and mix.', 'Add salt and mix well. Add cashewnut paste and mix well. Add 2 tbsps water and mix well.', 'Add tamarind pulp, crushed black peppercorns and sugar, and mix well. Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes or till prawns are done. Add coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Take the pan off the heat and transfer the prawns into a serving bowl. Garnish with scraped coconut and coriander leaves and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Paneer (cottage cheese) cut into 1 inch pieces 400 grams Black peppercorns  10-15   Oil  3 tablespoons Dried red chillies  6-8   Scraped coconut  Â½ cup Coriander seeds  1 teaspoon Cumin seeds  Â½ teaspoon Green cardamoms  3   Cloves  2   Cinnamon  1 inch stick Star anise  Â½   Fennel seeds (saunf)  1 teaspoon Curry leaves  10-12   Ginger paste  2 teaspoons Tomatoes chopped 3 medium Red chilli powder  1 teaspoon Turmeric powder  Â½ teaspoon Lemon juice  1 tablespoon Salt   to taste coriander sprig   for garnishing
Method: ['Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan and sautÃ© red chillies, coconut, black peppercorns, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, star anise and fennel seeds till fragrant. Cool and grind to a fine paste using water as required. ', 'Heat remaining oil in the same non-stick pan and add curry leaves and the ground paste and sautÃ© for 1-2 minutes. Add ginger paste and sautÃ© for a minute. ', 'Add tomatoes, chilli powder, turmeric powder and cottage cheese and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes.', 'Add 2 cups water, lemon juice and salt. Cover and cook for 2 minutes.', 'Garnish with coriander sprig. Serve hot with boiled rice or paranthe.']

Ingredients: Surmai darnes   400 grams Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Lemon juice  1/2 teaspoon Garlic cloves roughly chopped 7-8   Ginger roughly chopped 1 inch Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Fennel seeds (saunf)  1 teaspoon Coriander seeds  2 teaspoons Black peppercorns  2 teaspoons Red chilli powder  1 teaspoon Tamarind paste  1 teaspoon Oil 1 teaspoon + 2 tablespoons  for shallow frying
Method: ['Marinate fish pieces with salt, turmeric powder and lemon juice and set aside for fifteen minutes.', 'Put garlic, ginger, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, coriander seeds, black peppercorns, salt, red chilli powder and tamarind paste in a mixer jar and blend to a smooth paste.', 'Apply this paste to the fish pieces and set aside for an hour.', 'Heat two tablespoons oil in a non-stick pan and shallow fry the fish from both sides till properly cooked.', 'Drain on absorbent paper.  Serve hot.']

Ingredients: Crisp papdi  24   Yogurt whisked 1 1/2 cups Salt   to taste Sugar  1 tablespoon Potatoes boiled and chopped 2 medium Sprouted green gram blanched 1/2 cup Red chilli-garlic chutney  1/4 cup Green chutney  1/4 cup Sweet tamarind chutney  1/4 cup Roasted cumin powder  1 teaspoon Chaat masala  1/2 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Fresh coriander leaves  2 tablespoons Sev   as required Pomegranate (anar) peeled 2 tablespoons
Method: ['Add salt and sugar to yogurt and whisk till smooth. Keep it in the refrigerator till use. Arrange the papdis on a plate. ', 'Place some potatoes on each papdi. Over that put some boiled sprouted moong. Drizzle a little red chilli-garlic chutney, green chutney and sweet tamarind chutney.', 'Sprinkle cumin powder, chaat masala, a little red chilli powder and salt. Top it all up with chilled yogurt.', 'Drizzle some more of the sweet tamarind chutney, red chilli-garlic chutney, coriander leaves, sev and pomegranate pearls. ', 'Serve immediately.']

Ingredients: Tamrind  1 cup Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Jaggery (gur),grated  1 1/4 cups Cinnamon   1 inch  stick Raisins  2 tablespoons Salt   to taste Black salt (kala namak)   1/4 teaspoon Red chilli powder   1 teaspoon Dry ginger powder (soonth)   1 1/2 teaspoons
Method: ['Soak the tamarind in two cups of warm water for half an hour. Extract pulp and strain to remove seeds and fiber. Dry roast cumin seeds and grind to a powder.', 'Take a heavy bottom pan, add the tamarind pulp and jaggery. Cook on low heat. Add cinnamon stick and cook for fifteen minutes. Add raisins, salt, black salt, red chilli powder, roasted cumin powder and dry ginger powder.', 'Remove from heat, allow to cool, store in an airtight container.']

Ingredients: Beetroot puree  1/4 cup Gram flour (besan)  1 cup Refined flour (maida)  1 tablespoon Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Ginger-green chilli paste  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Buttermilk  3 cups Oil   for greasing Fresh coconut , scraped  to garnish Fresh coriander leaves , chopped  to garnish Tempering     Oil  2 tablespoons Mustard seeds   1 teaspoon Asafoetida (hig)  1/4 teaspoon Curry leaves  1 sprigs
Method: ['Put gram flour in a bowl, add refined flour, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, ginger-green chilli paste and salt and mix well. Add buttermilk and mix till there are no lumps.', 'Heat a deep non-stick pan. Pour the batter into it and cook on medium heat, whisking continuously till the mixture thickens. ', 'Grease the back side of steel thalis with some oil. ', 'Add beetroot puree to the cooking mixture and mix well and cook further on medium heat for 1-2 minutes. ', 'While the mixture is still hot spread a thin layer of the batter with a palette knife on the greased thalis and set aside to cool. ', 'After the mixture cools down, sets and the colour deepens, cut the layers vertically into thick strips, and roll each strip starting from one end to another. Insert coloured toothpick in center of each khandvi and arrange them on a plate.', 'To prepare the tempering, heat oil in a non-stick tempering pan. Add mustard seeds and let them sputter. Add asafoetida and curry leaves and mix well. ', 'Pour the tempering over khandvis, garnish with coconut and coriander leaves and serve. ']

Ingredients: Multi grain flour  1 cup Split pigeon pes (tuvar dal) , soaked for 1/2 hour 1 cup Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/2 tsp +  pinches Raw peanuts  1/2 cup Gram flour (besan)  2 tablespoons Red chilli powder  1 pinch   Ghee  1 tablespoon Mustard seeds  1/2 teaspoon Asafoetida (hing)  1/4 teaspoon Fenugreek seeds (methi dana)  1/2 teaspoon Curry leaves  6   Dried red chillies  2   Dal tadka masala  1 1/2 tablespoons Jagger , chopped 1 teaspoon Fresh coriander leaves , chopped 1 tablespoon Khakras   to serve
Method: ['Heat a pressure cooker, add split pigeon peas, salt, Â½ tsp turmeric powder, peanuts and 2 cups water. Cover the cooker and cook under pressure till 4-5 whistles are released.', 'Meanwhile take multigrain flour, gram flour, salt, remaining turmeric powder and red chilli powder in a bowl and mix well. Add sufficient water and knead into stiff dough. Cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'Take small portions of dough and roll them on back of a fork to shape into gnocchis.', 'Uncover the cooker when the pressure settles completely.', 'Heat ghee in a deep non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add asafoetida, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, dried red chillies and the cooked pigeon peas. Mix well for 1 minute on medium heat. Add dal tadka masala and mix well. Add sufficient water to get the required consistency and mix well. ', 'Add the gnocchis and mix well. Cover and cook on medium heat for 15-20 minutes. ', 'Adjust salt, add jaggery and coriander leaves and mix till jaggery dissolves. Switch the heat off.', 'Put ladles full of cooked dal dhokli into serving plates and serve hot with khakras.']

Ingredients: Fresh tuvar pods , shelled 200 grams Fresh coriander-coconut-ginger-green chilli paste  1/2 cup Oil  2 tablespoons Onion , chopped 1 medium Potato  1 medium Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Fresh coriander sprig   to garnish
Method: ['Heat oil in an earthen pot, add onion and sautÃ© till golden brown. ', 'Meanwhile slice potato and soak in a bowl of water. ', 'Add turmeric powder to the onion mixture and mix well. Add fresh coriander-coconut-ginger-green chilli paste, mix and sautÃ© well.', 'Drain and add potato and fresh tuvar and mix well. Add salt and mix well.', 'Add 1 cup water, mix well, cover and cook till both potato and tuvar are cooked completely. ', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Finger millet (ragi) flour  1 cup Oats , powdered 1/2 cup Split skinless black gram (dhuli urad dal) flour  1/2 cup Yogurt  1/3 cup Salt   to taste Cumin powder  1/2 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Ginger-green chilli paste  1 teaspoon Baking soda  1/2 teaspoon Oil  1 tbsp + for greasing Green chutney   to sprinkle Tempering     Oil  2 tablespoons Mustard seeds  1 teaspoon White sesame seeds  2 teaspoons Green chillies , slit 1-2   Curry leaves  6-8   Sugar  1 teaspoon Fresh coriander leaves , chopped  to garnish
Method: ['Take finger millet flour in a mixing bowl, add oats powder, split skinless black gram flour, yogurt and 1Â¼ cups water and whisk till a smooth batter is formed. Cover and set aside to ferment for 6-8 hours.', 'Add salt, cumin powder, red chilli powder, ginger-green chilli paste and baking soda and mix well. ', 'Heat sufficient water in a steamer. Brush a dhokla thali with some oil.  ', 'Add 1 tbsp oil to the batter and mix well. Pour this into the greased thali.', 'Place the thali into the steamer. Cover and steam for 12-15 minutes. ', 'Remove the thali from the steamer and allow to cool slightly.', 'Loosen the dhokla from the sides of the thali and cut into squares. ', 'To make the tempering, heat oil in a small pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add white sesame seeds, green chillies, curry leaves and sugar and mix well. Add Â¼ cup water and mix well. Pour this over the dhokla. ', 'Separate the dhokla squares and place on a serving plate. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve with green chutney.']

Ingredients: Oats  1 cup Semolina (rawa/suji)  1/2 cup Yogurt  1/2 cup Ginger-green chilli paste  1 tablespoon Sugar  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Fruit salt q 1 1/4 teaspoons Tempering     Oil  2 tablespoons Mustard seeds  1 teaspoon Green chillies , slit 1-2   Curry leaves  a handful
Method: ['Heat a shallow non-stick pan, add oats and dry roast, on low heat, for 10-15 minutes. Transfer onto a plate and cool. Put into a grinder jar and grind them into a coarse powder and transfer into a mixing bowl.', 'In same pan dry roast semolina, on low heat, for 10 minutes. Transfer into the same bowl.', 'Add yogurt, Â½ cup water, ginger-green chili paste, sugar and salt   and mix into a smooth batter. ', 'Heat sufficient water in a steamer. Grease a vessel with oil.', 'Add fruit salt to batter and mix well. Pour the batter into the greased vessel. Keep the vessel in the steamer and steam for 15-20 minutes or until cooked. ', 'Take the vessel out of the steamer and set aside to cool down to room temperature. Cut into pieces.', 'For tempering, heat oil in a small non-stick pan, add  mustard seeds, curry leaves and slit green chillies. When the seeds splutter pour this over the steamed dhokla.', 'Arrange the dhokla pieces on a serving platter and serve hot with green chutney.']

Ingredients: Amaranth (rajgira) flour  1 cup Barnyard millet (samo) flour  1/2 cup Salt   to taste Dried fenugreek leaves (kasuri methi)  1 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Cumin powder  1/4 teaspoon Coriander powder  1/4 teaspoon Ginger-green chilli paste  1/2 tablespoon Sugar  1 1/2 teaspoons Dried mango powder (amchur)  1/4 teaspoon Ghee  2 1/2 tablespoons
Method: ['Heat ghee in a small pan.', 'Take amaranth flour in a large bowl, add barnyard millet flour, salt, dried fenugreek leaves, red chilli powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, ginger-green chilli paste, sugar and dried mango powder.  Add hot ghee to the flour mixture and mix well.', 'Add 1 cup water and knead into a soft dough. Cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside for 5 minutes.', 'Take a large portion of the dough and roll into a large thick disc. Cut out roundels with a cookie cutter.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa. Place a few discs on it and cook on medium heat for 2 minutes, flip and cook the other side for 2 minutes as well. Press the discs with a wooden spoon so that the discs do not puff up. Flip again and continue to press lightly. Repeat the process till the discs turn golden and crisp on both sides.', 'Place them on a cooling wire rack for a few minutes or till they cool down to room temperature.', 'Arrange them on a serving platter and serve. Or store in an airtight container.']

Ingredients: Boneless mutton , cut into 1 inch cubes 300 grams Yogurt  1/2 cup Salt   to taste Red chilli powder  1 teaspoon Garam masala powder  1/2 teaspoon Green chilli paste  1 teaspoon Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Ginger-garlic paste  1 1/2 tablespoons Ghee  1 tablespoon Caraway seeds (shahi jeera)  1 teaspoon Black peppercorns  1/2 teaspoon Split skinless green gram (dhuli moong dal) , soaked for 2-3 hours 2 tablespoons Split Bengal gram (chana dal) , soaked for 2-3 hours 2 tablespoons Split black gram with skin (chilkewali urad dal) , soaked for 2-3 hours 2 tablespoons Split skinless black gram (dhuli urad dal) , soaked for 2-3 hours 2 tablespoons Broken wheat (dalia) , soaked for 2-3 hours 1/2 cup Meat masala  2 teaspoons Fresh mint leaves , chopped 2 tablespoons Fresh coriander leaves , chopped 2 tablespo for garnishing Fried onions  2 tablespo for garnishing Mutton stock  4-5 cups Milk  1/4 cup Lemon slices   for garnishing Fresh mint sprig for gar  for garnishing
Method: ['Take mutton in a bowl, add yogurt, salt, red chilli powder, garam masala powder, green chilli paste, turmeric powder and 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste and mix well. Set aside in a refrigerator to marinate for 1 hour.', 'Heat ghee in a pressure cooker, add caraway seeds and sautÃ© till they change colour. Add black peppercorns and remaining ginger-garlic paste, mix and sautÃ© for 1 minute on medium heat.', 'Add split green gram, split Bengal gram and split black gram with skin, mix and sautÃ© well for 1 minute. Add split skinless black gram and broken wheat and mix well.   ', 'Add salt and meat masala and mix well. Add the marinated meat and mix well. Add mint leaves, coriander leaves, 2 tbsps fried onions and mutton stock and mix well. Cover the cooker and cook under pressure, on medium heat, till 6-7 whistles are given out. Switch the heat off.', 'Open the lid once the pressure settles and blend the mixture with a hand blender. ', 'Heat the mixture again. Add milk and mix well. Adjust salt and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot garnished with lemon slices, coriander leaves, fried onions and a mint sprig. ']

Ingredients: Mutton mince  300 grams Ghee  2 tablespoons Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Green cardamoms  4   Black peppercorns  6-8   Cloves  4   Cinnamon  1/2 inch   Dried red chillies  2   Garlic  3-4 cloves Split Bengal gram (chana dal) soaked 1/2 cup Salt   to taste Onion finely chopped 1 tablespoon Green chillies finely chopped 1 teaspoon Fresh coriander leaves finely chopped 1 tablespoon Fresh mint leaves finely chopped 1 tablespoon Garam masala powder  1 teaspoon Lemon juice  1 tablespoon Egg  1   Chaat masala   to sprinkle
Method: ['Heat 1 tablespoon ghee in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds, green cardamoms, black peppercorns, cinnamon, dried red chillies, garlic cloves and mutton mince and mix well. ', 'Add chana dal, salt and 1 cup water and mix well. Cover and cook till the mince is cooked.   ', 'Take the pan off the heat and cool. Transfer the mixture into a mixer jar and grind to smooth paste.  Transfer the mixture into a mixing bowl.', 'Add onion, green chillies, coriander leaves, fresh mint leaves, garam masala powder and lemon juice and mix well.', 'Divide the mixture into 8 equal portions and shape each portion into tikkis and place them on a plate.', 'Break the egg into a bowl, add a little salt and whisk well.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a non-stick pan. Dip the tikkis in the egg mixture, place them in the pan and shallow-fry, turning sides, till evenly golden brown on both sides. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange the kababs on a serving platter and serve hot with onion rings, lemon wedges and green chutney.']

Ingredients: Skimmed milk  1 1/2 litres Olive oil  1 tablespoon Whole-wheat vermicelli roasted 100 grams saffron strands   a few Sunflower seeds (charoli/chironji)  2 tablespoons Green cardamom powder  1/2 teaspoon Nutmeg grated  a pinch Sugar substitute sucralose  6 teaspoons Almonds blanched and slivered 3-4   Pistachios blanched and slivered 3-4
Method: ['Boil the milk until it has reduced in volume by roughly a quarter.', 'Heat the olive oil in a kadai, then add the vermicelli, stirring gently. Stir in the reduced milk.', 'Add the saffron, sunflower seeds, cardamom powder and nutmeg, and cook for about 5 minutes.', 'Stir in the sugar substitute and nuts, taste for sweetness and serve immediately.']

Ingredients: Small brinjals (baingan)  250 grams Medium onions quaertered 2   Coriander seeds  1 1/2 tablespoons Sesame seeds (til)  1 1/2 tablespoons Fenugreek seeds (methi dana)  1/4 teaspoon Peanuts  2 tablespoons Poppy seeds (khus khus)  3/4 teaspoon Cumin seeds  1/2 teaspoon Dried coconut (khopra) grated 2 tablespoons Ginger chopped 1 inch   Garlic  chopped 6-8 cloves Turmeric powder  1 pinch   Red chilli powder  1/2 tablespoon Jaggery grarted 1/2 tablespoon Tamarind pulp  2 tablespoons Salt   to taste Oil  2 tablespoons Curry leaves  1 sprig
Method: ['Trim the stems of the brinjals slightly, wash then and make crisscross slit on the bottom side taking care that the brinjal is held together at the stem.', 'Heat a non-stick pan, add onions and dry roast till they turn lightly brown and soften. Transfer them onto a plate.  ', 'Add coriander seeds, sesame seeds, fenugreek seeds, peanuts, poppy seeds, cumin seeds and dried coconut in the same pan, mix and dry roast till they begin to change colour and give out a nice aroma. Transfer this mixture onto the same plate. Add ginger, garlic, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and jaggery and mix well and let the mixture cool down.', 'Transfer the mixture into a grinder jar, add a little water and grind to a fine paste.  Add tamarind pulp and mix well. Transfer into a bowl, add tamarind pulp and mix well. Add salt and mix well.\n', 'Stuff this masala into the slit brinjals and reserve the remaining.\n', 'Heat oil in a non-stick kadai, add curry leaves and sautÃ© for 1 minute.  Add the stuffed brinjals and sautÃ© for about 5 minutes.  Add the reserved masala and mix gently.  Add 1 cup of water, mix well, cover and cook over low heat till the brinjals are fully cooked and oil surfaces.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Large potatoes boiled, peeled and grated 4   Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Coriander seeds cruhsed 2 teaspoons Garlic-red chilli chutney  1 tablespo to spread Green chutney  1 teaspoon   Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespo to sprinkle White bread slices  8   Refined flour  1/2 cup Cornflour  1 tablespoon Oil   to shallow fry Onion chopped  to serve Sev   as required
Method: ['Take potatoes in a bowl, add salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, crushed coriander seeds, garlic-red chilli chutney, green chutney and coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Spread this mixture on one side of the bread slices. ', 'Take refined flour in another bowl, add cornflour, salt and 1 cup water, mix well and make a thin batter.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a non-stick pan, dip the potato side of the bread slices in this flour batter and place it in hot oil and shallow-fry, turning sides till evenly golden brown and crisp on both sides. Drain on an absorbent paper.', 'Cut the toasts diagonally into 2 pieces, place them on serving plates, apply garlic-red chilli chutney and green chutney, sprinkle sev, onion and coriander leaves and serve immediately. ']

Ingredients: Cooked rice  3 cups Tamarind pulp  2 tablespoons Oil  2 tablespoons Mustard seeds  1/2 teaspoon Split Bengal gram (chana dal)  1/2 teaspoon Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal)  1/2 teaspoon Asafoetida   a pinch Curry leaves  8-10   Dried red chillies  2   Green chilli chopped 1   Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Roasted peanuts peeled 1/2 cup White sesame seeds for garnish + 1 tablespoon coriander sprig   for garnish
Method:
['Heat oil in a non-stick wok, add mustard seeds, split Bengal gram, , split black gram, and saute till the colour of the grams change.
', 'Add asafoetida, curry leaves, broken dried red chillies and green chilli and mix well.
', 'Add tamarind pulp and 2-3 tbsps water and mix well. Add salt, turmeric powder, roasted peanuts, sesame seeds and rice and mix well.  Cover and cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes.
', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with sesame seeds and a  coriander sprig and serve hot.
']

Ingredients: Sweetcorn kernels , boiled 1 cup Mixed sprouts  1/2 cup Potato , boiled and peeled 1 large Beetroot , boiled, peeled and cut into small cubes 1 small Onion , chopped 1 medium Date and tamarind chutney  2 tablespoons Green chutney  2 tablespoons Raw mango , chopped 1/2 small Lemon juice  2 tablespoons Fresh coriander leaves , chopped 2 tablespoons Sev  3 tablespoons Crisp papdi  6-8
Method: ['Boil water in a deep non-stick pan, add mixed sprouts and cook until the sprouts are cooked.', 'Cut potato in to small cubes. Drain sprouts and set aside to cool.', 'Take sweetcorn kernels in a mixing bowl, add potato and sprouts in a bowl. Add beetroot, onion, date and tamarind chutney and green chutney and mix well. ', 'Add raw mango, lemon juice, coriander leaves and sev and mix well.', 'Break the papdi and add to the bhel and mix. Pack the bhel in tiffin box.']

Ingredients: Full cream milk  1 litre   Fresh cream  1 cup Vinegar  1/2 cup Dough , made with 1 1/2 cups whole wheat flour    Processed cheese , grated 1/2 cup Onion , chopped 1 small Green chillies , chopped 2   Red chilli powder  1 teaspoon Garam masala powder  1/2 teaspoon Chaat masala  1 1/2 teaspoons Carom seeds (ajwain)  1/2 teaspoon Fresh coriander leaves , chopped 2 tablespoons Salt   to taste Ghee   for shallow frying
Method: ['To make paneer heat milk in a deep non-stick pan, add cream and bring it to a boil. Add vinegar and mix well.', 'Keep a large sieve over a bowl and line it with a muslin cloth. When the milk curdles, pour it in the sieve and strain the excess whey. Gather the edges of the cloth together and put it in cold water. Remove from water, keep it again in the sieve and keep a heavy weight over it. Set aside for 2 hours to let all the water drain away.', 'To make the stuffing, crumble the paneer into a bowl. Add cheese, onion, green chillies, red chilli powder, garam masala, chaat masala, carom seeds, fresh coriander leaves and salt and mix well.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions. Shape into balls and press between your palms, make a cavity in the centre of each ball and add spoonful of paneer stuffing, bring the edges together and seal completely.', 'Roll them out into five inch diameter paranthe. ', 'Heat a non-stick tawa, place one parantha at a time on it and cook for Â½ minute. Flip it and apply ghee on the cooked side. Turn it over again and spread a little more ghee on the other side too. Cook, turning sides, till both sides are evenly cooked and golden brown.', 'Wrap the paranthe in Freshwrapp and pack it in tiffin with yogurt packed in a small container with lid.']

Ingredients: Puffed rice (kurmura)  3 cups Jaggery , chopped 3/4 cup Ghee  2 tbsps + for greasing Creamy peanut butter  1/4 cup Mixed fruit jam  1 tablespoon Peanuts , roasted and crushed 1/4 cup Dark chocolate , melted 1 cup Salt   to sprinkle Walnuts   to garnish Peanuts , roasted and peeled  to garnish Split Bengal gram , roasted  to garnish Fresh coriander sprigs   to garnish
Method: ['Heat a non-stick wok, add jaggery, ghee and peanut butter and cook on medium heat till jaggery melts.', 'Add jam and mix well. Add puffed rice and crushed peanuts and mix well. ', 'Grease an aluminum tray with ghee. Transfer the mixture onto the tray and spread it evenly, roll a rolling pin over it to level the top and set aside until it sets.', 'Demould and cut into thick sticks and then cut each stick into half.', 'Dip half the bar pieces in melted dark chocolate and place it on a wire rack, sprinkle some salt on it. ', 'Garnish the rest with walnuts, peanuts, roasted Bengal gram and coriander sprigs. ', 'Arrange the sticks on a serving plate and serve.']

Ingredients: Semolina (rawa / suji)  1 cup Rice flour  1/2 cup Refined flour (maida)  1/4 cup Fresh coriander leaves , chopped 1 tablespoon Ginger , finely chopped 1 teaspoon Cashewnuts , chopped 1 tablespoon Black peppercorns , crushed  to taste Salt   to taste Ghee  for brushi for drizzling Black olive slices   to garnish Sweetcorn kernels , boiled  to garnish Coconut chutney   to serve
Method: ['Take semolina in a large bowl, add rice flour and refined flour and mix well. Add coriander leaves, ginger, cashewnuts, crushed black peppercorns, salt and 3 cups water and whisk till a smooth and thin batter is formed. Set aside for 15 minutes. ', 'Heat a non-stick tawa on high heat and brush some ghee over it.', 'Drizzle the batter on the hot tawa to make a thin dosa. Drizzle some ghee all around and cook, on medium heat, for 2-3 minutes or till the underside turns crisp. Fold the dosa in half and place on a serving plate. Make more dosas similarly.', 'Garnish with black olive slices and boiled sweetcorn kernels. Serve warm with coconut chutney. ']

Ingredients: Finger millet flour (ragi atta)  1 cup Yogurt  1/2 cup Split skinless black gram flour (dhuli urad dal atta)  1 cup Salt   to taste Green peas , shelled  as required Tomato , cut into small triangles  as required Carrot , cut into thin strips  as required Coconut chutney   to serve Sambhar   to serve
Method: ['Take yogurt in a bowl, add â\x85\x93 cup water and whisk well. Add ragi flour and whisk well. Add Â½ cup water and whisk till a smooth batter is formed. ', 'Add split skinless black gram flour and whisk again. Add Â¾ cup water and whisk till a lump free batter is formed. Cover and set aside to ferment for 8-10 hours. ', 'Heat sufficient water in a steamer.', 'Add salt into the fermented batter and mix well. ', 'Take a non-stick idli mould and pour batter into each cavity upto Â¾ full. Arrange some green peas, tomato triangles and carrot strips on top of the batter. ', 'Place the idli mould in the steamer, cover and steam for 10 minutes or till the idlis are completely done.  ', 'Remove the idli mould and allow to cool slightly. De-mould the idlis and serve warm with coconut chutney and sambhar. ']

Ingredients: Whole green gram (sabut moong) , soaked for 6-8 hours and drained 1/2 cup Green peas (hare matar) , shelled 1/4 cup Rice , soaked for 20 minutes and drained 3/4 cup Ghee  1 tbsp + for drizzling Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Carom seeds (ajwain)  1/4 teaspoon Cloves  2-4   Black peppercorns  6-8   Cinnamon  1 inch   Garlic , finely chopped 2 teaspoons Ginger , finely chopped 1 teaspoon Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Salt   to taste Roasted mini papads   to garnish Sweetcorn kernels , boiled  to garnish Carrot flowers , boiled  to garnish Red cherry tomatoes , quartered  to garnish
Method: ['Heat ghee in a pressure cooker, add cumin seeds, carom seeds, cloves, black peppercorns and cinnamon, mix and sautÃ© till fragrant. Add garlic and ginger, mix and sautÃ© for a few seconds. ', 'Add whole green gram, mix and cook for 1 minute. Add rice and mix well. Add green peas and mix. Add turmeric powder, mix and sautÃ© for a few seconds.', 'Add salt and mix till well combined. Add 4 cups water, mix well, cover and cook till 3-4 whistles are released. ', 'Open the cooker once the pressure has reduced completely.', 'Transfer the khichdi into a serving bowl, drizzle ghee and garnish with mini papads, boiled sweet corn kernels, boiled carrot flowers and red cherry tomato quarters and serve warm. ']

Ingredients: Raw bananas , boiled, peeled and mashed 3/4 cup Cabbage , finely chopped 2 tablespoons French beans , finely chopped 1 tablespoon Green capsicum , finely choppd 1 tablespoon Green chillies , finely chopped 1 teaspoon Fresh coriander leaves , finely chopped 1 tbsp + to garnish Black pepper powder   to taste Red chilli flakes  1/2 teaspoon Dried ginger powder (saunth)  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Cornflour  1 tablespoon Refined flour (maida)  1/2 tablespoon Oil   to deep fry Soy-chilli sauce     Soy sauce  1 tablespoon Green chilli sauce  2 tablespoons Tomato ketchup  1 tablespoon Black pepper powder   to taste Dried ginger powder  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Red chilli flakes  1/4 teaspoon
Method: ['Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Take raw bananas in a mixing bowl, add cabbage, French beans, green capsicum, green chillies, coriander leaves, pepper powder, chilli flakes, dried ginger powder and salt and mix well. Add cornflour and refined flour and mix well. ', 'Divide the mixture into equal medium sized portions and shape them into balls. Gently slide these balls into hot oil and deep-fry until golden-brown. Drain on absorbent paper. ', 'To make soya-chilli sauce, heat another non-stick pan. Add green chilli sauce, tomato ketchup, soy sauce and 3 tablespoons water and mix well. Add pepper powder, dried ginger powder, salt and chilli flakes, mix and cook for 1-2 minutes. ', 'Skew each Manchurian ball on a satay stick and arrange them on a serving plate. Pour some soy-chilli sauce over them, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Garlic , chopped 3 teaspoons Green capsicum  1 medium Carrot , peeled and cut into small cubes 1 medium Button mushrooms  10-12   Chinese black mushrooms , soaked 3-4   Broccoli florets , blanched 12-16   Cashewnuts  1/4 cup Sweetcorn  1/4 cup Oil  3 tablespoons Vegetable stock  1 cup Star anise  1   Salt   to taste White pepper powder  1/4 teaspoon Cornflour slurry  2 tablespoons
Method: ['Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick wok. Cut capsicum into Â½ inch pieces. ', 'Add cashewnuts to the wok and saute till lightly coloured. Transfer into a bowl.', 'Heat 2 tbsps oil in the same wok, add capsicum and saute for 1 minute. Drain and put into another bowl.', 'Add 2 tsps garlic to the oil remaining in the wok and sautÃ© for 30 seconds. Add carrot and mix. Halve the mushrooms with the stems and add and toss. ', 'Drain and roughly chop Chinese mushrooms and add along with sweetcorn and mix well.  Add vegetable stock, star anise, salt and white pepper powder, mix well and cook. ', 'Add broccoli florets to the wok.  Add cornflour slurry and mix. Add 1 tsp garlic and mix. Switch off the heat.', 'Add cashewnuts and green capsicum (keeping aside a few of each for garnish) and mix.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with reserved cashewnuts and capsicum and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Chicken lollipops  10   Soy sauce  1 teaspoon Garlic paste  1 tablespoon Refined flour (maida)  3 teaspoons Red chilli paste  1 tablespoon Egg  1   Salt   to taste Sweet chilli sauce  1 tablespoon Vinegar  2 teaspoons Oil   to deep fry Plum sauce     Plums , seeded and coarsely pureed 8-10   Oil  2 tablespoons Onion , finely chopped 1 medium Garlic , chopped 1 tablespoon Salt   to taste Red chilli paste  1 teaspoon Sugar  1 cup Vinegar  1 teaspoon
Method: ['Put soy sauce, garlic paste, refined flour, red chilli paste, egg and salt in a large bowl and mix well. Add 1 tsp water and mix well. Add sweet chilli sauce and vinegar and mix. Add chicken lollipops and mix well. Keep them in the refrigerator for about 1 hour to marinate.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a deep pan.', 'To make plum sauce, heat 2 tbsps oil in a non-stick pan, add onion and garlic, mix and saute till they soften. Add plum puree and mix. Add salt and red chilli paste and mix well and cook on medium heat.', 'Slide the marinated lollipops into hot oil and deep-fry till cooked and crisp. ', 'Add sugar to the sauce and mix till all the sugar dissolves.', 'Drain the lollipops on absorbent paper.', 'Add vinegar to the sauce and mix well. Switch off the heat and transfer the sauce into a small bowl.', 'Arrange the lollipops on a serving plate and serve hot with the plum sauce.']

Ingredients: Cauliflower , separated into medium florets  1 medium Oil  1 tablespo to deep fry Ginger-garlic paste  2 teaspoons Red chilli sauce  1 tablespoon Dark soy sauce  1 1/2 teaspoons Salt   to taste Crushed black peppercorns   to taste Refined flour (maida)  2-3 tablespoons Cornflour/ corn starch  2-3 tablespoons Garlic , chopped 1 tablespoon Ginger , chopped 1 inch Green chillies , finely chopped 1-2   Spring onion greens , diagonally sliced 1-2 stalks Tomato ketchup  1 tablespoon Cornflour/ corn starch slurry  1 tablespoon Vinegar  1 teaspoon Spring onion green curls   for garnishing Fried rice   to serve
Method: ['Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. \n', 'Take cauliflower florets in a bowl, add ginger-garlic paste, red chilli sauce, 1 teaspoon soy sauce, salt and crushed peppercorns and mix well. Add refined flour and corn flour and mix till well coated. ', 'Slide the marinated cauliflower florets into hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper. ', 'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan, add garlic and ginger, mix and sautÃ© till golden brown. ', 'Add green chillies, mix and sautÃ© for 30 seconds. Add spring onion greens, mix and sautÃ© for 30 seconds. ', 'Add 2 cups of water and mix. Add tomato ketchup and mix. Add remaining soy sauce and mix well. ', 'Add salt and crushed peppercorns, mix and bring the mixture to a boil. Add corn flour slurry, mix and cook till the mixture thickens slightly. ', 'Add fried cauliflower florets, mix and cook for 1-2 minutes. Switch off heat, add vinegar and mix well. ', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with spring onion green curls and serve hot with fried rice. ']

Ingredients: Basmati rice ,soaked for 15-20 minutes  1 1/2  cups Garlic   10-12 cloves French beans  5-6   Cabbage  1/4 medium Carrot  1/2 medium Spring onion bulbs  2-3   Spring onion greens  1 stalk Salt   to taste Oil  1 tablespoon Soy sauce  1 teaspoon Vinegar  1 teaspoon
Method: ['Finely chop garlic cloves, string the French beans and chop them finely. Finely shred cabbage, peel and grate carrot. Slice spring onion bulbs and finely chop the spring onion green stalk.', 'Boil sufficient water in a deep pan and add salt. Drain and add the rice cover and cook till the rice is Â¾ done. Drain and spread the rice on a plate to cool down.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick wok, add garlic and sautÃ© on high heat till golden brown. Add spring onion bulbs, mix and sautÃ© for 30 seconds. ', 'Add French beans, carrot and cabbage, mix and sautÃ© for 1 minute. Add salt and soy sauce and mix well. ', 'Add rice and adjust salt, toss and cook for 1 minute. Cover and cook on low heat for 2 minutes. Switch off heat, add vinegar and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with spring onion greens and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Cottage cheese (paneer) cut into 1Â½ inch thick strips 300 grams Wonton sheets shredded 15-20   Ginger-garlic paste  1 tablespoon Soy sauce  1 teaspoon Green chilli sauce  1 tablespoon Salt   to taste Crushed black peppercorns   to taste Oil   for deep-frying Refined flour-cornstarch batter  2 cups Schezwan sauce   to serve
Method: ['Take cottage cheese strips in a bowl, add ginger-garlic paste, soy sauce, green chilli sauce, salt and crushed peppercorns and mix well. ', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Spread shredded wonton strips on a plate. ', 'Add salt and crushed peppercorns to the batter and mix well. ', 'Dip each marinated cottage cheese strip in the batter, coat with shredded wonton sheets, slide into hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper. ', 'Arrange them on a serving plate and serve hot with Schezwan sauce.']

Ingredients: Multigrain khichdi mix  200 grams Ghee  2 tablespoons Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons Mozzarella cheese cubes  cut into Â½ inch cubes 50 grams Refined flour (maida)   as required Bread crumbs dried  as required Oil   for deep-frying Fresh parsley   for garnish Tomato sauce   to serve
Method:
['Place a strainer on a bowl, put the Multigrain Khichdi Mix in it and wash well with water. Place the strainer on another bowl so that excess water drains away. 
', 'Heat 2 tbsps ghee in a pressure cooker, add the masala premix that comes with the khichdi mix and sautÃ© for a few seconds or till the cumin seeds turn golden brown.
', 'Add the khichdi mix, mix well and sautÃ© for a few seconds. Add 500 ml water, mix well and allow the mixture to come to a boil. Put the lid on the cooker and cook under pressure till 4-5 whistles are released. Allow the pressure to reduce completely.
', 'Transfer the cooked khichdi onto a plate and allow to cool down. Add coriander leaves and mash the mixture well with your hand.
', 'Divide the mixture into equal portions and stuff each portion with a cheese cube and shape them into balls.
', 'Heat sufficient oil in a wok.
', 'Take refined slurry in a bowl and spread dried breadcrumbs on a plate. Dip each ball into slurry, coat them with breadcrumbs, slide them into the hot oil and deep-fry till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
', 'Put some tomato sauce in each soup spoons, keep one arancini in each spoon. Skew a sprig of fresh parsley on each toothpick and pierce them onto each arancini and serve immediately
']

Ingredients: Pizza sauce   as required Capsicum mixed, triangles 1 cup Button mushrooms sliced 6-8   Chicken sausages sliced 4   Sweet corn kernels  4 tablespoons Black olives  pitted and sliced  6-8   Mozzarella cheese cut into small cubes 40 grams Red chilli flakes  dried, for sprinkling    Dried oregano for sprinkling    Dough     Whole wheat flour (atta) cups 1 1/2  + for dusting Fresh yeast  20 grams Sugar  1 teaspoon Olive oil + for greasing 1 teaspoon Salt  1 teaspoon
Method:
['To make pizza dough, take yeast in a bowl, add  sugar and Â¼ cup warm water, mix well and set aside for 10 minutes to activate.
', 'Take whole wheat flour in a large bowl, add activated yeast, olive oil, salt and sufficient water, mix well and knead to soft dough.
', 'Cover the dough with a damp muslin cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes to prove.
', 'Dust flour on a worktop and knock back the proved dough. Take a portion of the dough, shape it like a ball,  place it on the worktop and flatten it slightly.Roll the dough into a disc and place it on a greased baking tray. Cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside for 10 minutes to prove. 
', 'Preheat the oven to 180Â° C.
', 'Apply pizza sauce and spread it evenly. Sprinkle some a few mixed capsicum triangles, a few mushroom slices, a few chicken sausage slices, 1 tbsp sweetcorn kernels, a few black olive slices and a few mozzarella cheese cubes and place the tray in the oven. Bake for 10-15 minutes.  Take it out of the oven and transfer to a serving dish.
', 'Sprinkle dried red chilli flakes and dried oregano over the pizza and serve hot.
']

Ingredients: Mini pizza bases  4   Sweet corn kernels boiled 1/4  cup Yellow capsicum finely chopped 1/2 small Red capsicum finely chopped 1/2 small Green capsicum finely chopped 1/2 small Paneer (cottage cheese) cut into small cubes 150 grams Veg mayonnaise  2 tablespoons Processed cheese  30 grams Red chilli flakes  1 teaspoon Dried mixed herbs  1 teaspoon Salt   to taste Paneer masala  1 teaspoon Butter   as required Green chutney   as required Tomato ketchup   to serve
Method:
['To make stuffing, take sweet corn in a large bowl, add yellow capsicum, red capsicum, green capsicum, cottage cheese and vegetarian mayonnaise. Grate cheese into the bowl, add red chilli flakes, mixed herbs, salt and paneer masala and mix well.
', 'Halve the pizza bases horizontally and apply butter and green chutney on the cut sides of all the halves.  Spread a portion of the stuffing on one side of each pizza base and cover it with the other.
', 'Heat a griller, apply a little butter on top of each sandwich and place it on the griller. Grill till golden brown and crisp on both sides.
', 'Arrange them on serving platter and serve hot with tomato ketchup and green chutney.
']

Ingredients: Milk  2 cups Fresh cream  1/2 cup Green cardamom powder  1/2 teaspoon Nutmeg powder  1/4 teaspoon Saffron   a few strands Sugar  1/2 cup Gelatin melted 2 tablespoons Pistachios blanched, peeled and chopped 4-5 + to garnish Almonds blanched, peeled and chopped 5-6 + to garnish Fresh rose petals   to garnish
Method: ['Heat milk into a deep non-stick pan, add cream and whisk till well mixed. Allow the mixture to come to a boil.', 'Add green cardamom powder, nutmeg powder and few saffron strands and mix well with a whisk. ', 'Add sugar and whisk till sugar dissolves completely. Add melted gelatine and whisk well.  ', 'Add pistachios and almonds and mix well. Set aside to cool down to room temperature.', 'Transfer the mixture into small glasses. Refrigerate for 2-3 hours or till the mixture sets.', 'Serve chilled garnished with almonds, pistachios and rose petals.']

Ingredients: Spinach puree  1Â½  cups Paneer (cottage cheese)  Â½  cup Dough for pasta  as required Capsicum mixed, finely chopped Â¼ cup Salt   to taste Crushed black peppercorns   to taste Refined flour (maida)   for dusting Ghee  1 tablespoon Garlic chopped 1 tablespoon Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Onion finely chopped 1 medium Butter  1 teaspoon Fresh cream 2 tablespoons  to sprinkle Olive oil  1 tablespoon Fresh coriander sprigs  1 for garnishing
Method: ['Combine cottage cheese, mixed bell peppers, salt and crushed peppercorns in a bowl and mix.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions. Dust the worktop with some flour and roll out each portion to a thin sheet. Cut into roundels with a small a cookie cutter and discard the excess dough.', 'Put some cottage cheese mixture in the center of half the roundels, apply some water on the edges, cover with remaining roundels and press the edges to seal. Press the edges using the back of a fork to create texture.', 'Heat ghee in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and cumin seeds and sautÃ© for 30 seconds. Add onion and sautÃ© till golden.', 'Add spinach puree, mix and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add salt and butter, mix and cook for 1 minute. Add 2-3 tablespoons water, mix and cook for 1 minute.Add cream, mix and cook for 1-2 minutes.', 'Boil some water in a deep non-stick pan.  Add olive oil, salt and ravioli and blanch for 6-8 minutes. Drain on a plate.', 'Put some spinach gravy in a serving bowl, place ravioli in the center and drizzle some cream on top.', 'Serve hot garnished with a coriander sprig.']

Ingredients: Refined flour (maida)  3 cups  + for dusting Baking powder  1 teaspoon Castor sugar (caster sugar)  1 teaspoon Butter  5 tablespoons Salt   to taste Milk  1 cup Oil   for greasing Melted butter  for brushi for basting Stuffing     Mozzarella cheese grated 1 cup Garlic cloves finely chopped 5-6   Salt   to taste Fresh coriander leaves chopped Â¼ cup
Method: ['Take flour in a bowl. Add baking powder, castor sugar, butter and salt and mix. Add milk and knead into a soft dough. Cover with damp muslin cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'To prepare stuffing, take cheese in another bowl. Add garlic, salt and coriander leaves and mix well.', 'Preheat oven to 200Â° C.', 'Grease a baking tray with some oil.', 'Dust the dough with some flour, divide into equal portions and shape into balls. ', 'Divide the stuffing into equal number of portions as the dough. ', 'Dust the worktop with some flour and roll out each ball into small thick disc. Place a portion of the stuffing in the center of each disc, bring the edges together, press lightly to seal and shape into balls.', 'Dust the worktop with some flour, place each ball, lightly press to flatten and roll out into small thick discs.', 'Place the discs on the greased tray and lightly brush with some melted butter. ', 'Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes.', 'Halve and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Spinach leaves (palak) blanched and chopped 1 cup Paneer (cottage cheese)  250 grams Tortillas refined flour (maida) 8   Olive oil 1 tablespoon  + for drizzling Cumin seeds  Â½ teaspoon Garlic chopped 1 teaspoon Salt   to taste Fresh cream  1 tablespoon Lemon juice  1 teaspoon Processed cheese grated  as required Mozzarella cheese grated  as required Tomato ketchup   as required
Method: ['Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan. Add cumin seeds and sautÃ© for 30 seconds.', 'Add garlic and sautÃ© for 1 minute. Add spinach, mix and cook for 2 minutes. Add salt and mix.', 'Switch off heat, add cream and lemon juice and mix well. Divide into 4 portions.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa. Place each tortilla on it, one at a time, and spread a portion of the spinach mixture on top.', 'Grate some cottage cheese over spinach, top with processed cheese and mozzarella cheese. Cover with another tortilla and drizzle some olive oil on the sides. Cook, flipping, till the cheese melts and both sides turn golden.', 'Cut into wedges and serve hot with tomato ketchup. ']

Ingredients: Onion finely chopped 1 medium Tomato finely chopped 1 medium  chana chor garam 1-1Â½ cups  large Pickled jalapenos finely chopped 1   coriander leaves chopped 1 tablespoon Salt   to taste Red chilli flakes  1 teaspoon Lemon juice  1 tablespoon Cheese sauce  Â¼ cup Processed cheese grated  as required
Method: ['Preheat oven to 180Âº C.', 'Put onion, tomato, jalapeno, coriander leaves, salt, red chilli flakes and lemon juice in a bowl and mix well.', 'Line an oval glass baking dish with chana chur garam and put onion mixture on top. Pour cheese sauce and cover with some processed cheese on top.', 'Place the baking dish in a baking tray. Place the baking tray in the preheated oven and bake for 8-10 minutes or till the cheese melts.', 'Serve immediately.']

Ingredients: Kidney beans soaked for 5-6 hours 2 cups Oil  1 tablespoon Garlic minced 1 tablespoon Onion chopped 1 medium Tomatoes chopped 3 medium Salt   to taste Paprika powder  1 teaspoon Lemon juice  1 tablespoon Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons Spring onions chopped  for garnishing Tabasco sauce   a few drops
Method: ['Heat oil in a pressure cooker. Add garlic, onion and sautÃ© for a minute or till the onion turns translucent.', 'Reserve some tomatoes for garnishing and add the remaining. SautÃ© well. Add kidney beans and stir to mix and cook for a minute.', 'Add 4-5 cups water, cover and pressure cook for 5-10 minutes. Transfer into a bowl and blend into a fine puree. ', 'Heat a non-stick pan. Transfer the puree into it, stir and add salt, paprika powder and lemon juice. Mix well and bring it to a boil.', 'Garnish with reserved tomatoes, chopped coriander, spring onions and Tabasco sauce and serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Split skinless black gram (dhuli urad dal) , soaked for 5-6 hours and drained 1 cup Red chilli powder  1 teaspoon Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Black peppercorns , crushed 1/2 teaspoon Asafoetida  1/4 teaspoon Salt   to taste Curry leaves , shredded 12   Oil   to deep fry Green chutney   to serve
Method: ['Put half the drained dal into a blender jar. Grind to a coarse paste and transfer into a bowl.', 'Put the remaining dal in the same blender jar. Add 5 tbsps water and grind to a smooth and fluffy batter. Transfer into the same bowl and beat well with hands.', 'Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, cumin seeds, crushed black peppercorns, asafoetida, salt and curry leaves and mix well.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Drop small portions of the batter and deep fry on medium heat till golden brown and crisp.', 'Drain on absorbent paper. Arrange on a serving plate and serve hot with green chutney.']

Ingredients: Split skinless black gram (dhuli urad dal)  1 cup Idli rawa  2 cups Salt   to taste Sugar  1 teaspoon Fresh jackfruit leaves  32-36 medium Coconut chutney    to serve Sambhar   to serve
Method: ['Wash split skinless black gram thoroughly with sufficient water   2-3 times. Add sufficient fresh water and let it soak for 4-5 hours.', 'Soak the idli rawa in sufficient water for 3-4 hours.', 'Drain the soaked split skinless black gram and put into a mixer jar. Add Â¼ cup water and grind to a smooth and fluffy paste. Transfer this into a large bowl.', 'Drain the soaked idli rawa and squeeze out the excess water. Add to the ground paste and mix well. Cover and set aside to ferment for 6-8 hours.', 'Add salt and sugar to the fermented batter and mix well. ', 'To make a kotte, arrange 2 sets of 2 jackfruit leaves overlapping each other with the stem side facing outwards and secure with toothpicks. Place these over each other to make a plus sign. Bring the four ends together and secure the sides with toothpicks to  make a cup. Pour the batter into these cups or kottes till Â¾ full.', 'Heat sufficient water in a steamer. Arrange the kottes on the steamer basket, cover the steamer and steam for 10-15 minutes.', 'Take the kottes out of the steamer and serve hot with coconut chutney and sambhar. Discard the toothpicks and jackfruit leaves before eating.']

Ingredients: Rice flour  1 1/2 cups Semolina  1/2 cup Green chillies , chopped 3   Red chilli powder  1 1/2 teaspoons Turmeric powder  3/4 teaspoon Salt   to taste Milk  1 1/2 cups Oil   as required Coconut chutney   to serve
Method: ['Take rice flour in a bowl, add semolina, green chillies, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt and mix well.', 'Add milk, 1Â½ cups water and mix well, ensuring there are no lumps left. Set aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'Heat a non-stick tawa. Spread a ladleful of batter evenly. Drizzle some oil around and cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes or till the underside is golden brown.', 'Flip and cook on other side for 2-3 minutes more. Use up the remaining batter similarly.', 'Keep each on individual serving plate and serve hot with coconut chutney.']

Ingredients: Sorghum (jowar) flour  1/2 cup Coriander seeds  1 tablespoon Cumin seeds  1/2 tablespoon Garlic  4 cloves Curry leaves  6-8   Green chillies , broken 2   Whole wheat flour  1/2 cup Gram flour (besan)  2 tablespoons Split skinless black gram (dhuli urad dal) flour  2 tablespoons Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Carom seeds (ajwain)  1/4 teaspoon Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Salt   to taste White sesame seeds  1/2 tablespoon Oil  to grease  to deep fry
Method: ['Put coriander seeds, cumin seeds, garlic cloves, curry leaves and green chillies in a blender jar and grind coarsely.', 'Transfer the ground paste into a bowl, add sorghum flour, whole wheat flour, gram flour, black gram flour, red chilli powder, carom seeds, turmeric powder, salt and sesame seeds and mix well.', 'Add Â¾ cup hot water and knead into a soft dough. Cover with a moist muslin cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Divide the dough into equal portions and roll into balls. Drizzle some oil over each ball, flatten and roll into thick disks. ', 'Slide the disks in hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and puffed. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving platter and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Prawns , peeled and deveined 2 cups Coriander seeds  2 teaspoons Fenugreek seeds (methi dana)  1/4 teaspoon Dried red chillies  2-3   Oil  2 tablespoons Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Garlic paste  2 teaspoons Fresh coconut , scraped 6 tablespoons Ginger , roughly chopped 1 1/2 inches Mustard seeds  1/2 teaspoon Curry leaves  15-20   Onion , chopped 1 medium Tamarind pulp  1 teaspoon
Method: ['Heat a non-stick pan, add coriander seeds, fenugreek seeds and red chillies and dry roast till fragrant.', 'Heat 2 tbsps oil in another non-stick pan. ', 'Take prawns in a bowl, add salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and garlic paste and mix well. Let them marinate for 10-15 minutes.', 'Put 4 tbsps coconut in a blender jar, add ginger, roasted spices and a little water and blend to a coarse paste. ', 'Add mustard seeds to the oil in the other pan and when they splutter add curry leaves and onion, mix and saute till lightly browned. ', 'Add ground paste, mix and saute for 2 minutes.  Add prawns, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add a little salt and tamarind pulp, mix well and cook.', 'Add 1 tbsp scraped coconut, mix well and cook till prawns are done.', 'Transfer onto a serving bowl, garnish with remaining coconut and save hot.']
