Ingredients: Short grain rice (kolum) , soaked for 6-8 hours and drained 2 cups Fresh coconut , scraped 1 cup Salt   to taste Oil   for greasi  for drizzling Green chutney   to serve
Method:
['Put rice in a grinder jar, add coconut and grind them coarsely. Add 1 cup water and grind into a smooth batter. Transfer into a bowl. 
', 'Add some more water and salt to the batter and mix well to get a thin and smooth batter.
', 'Heat a non-stick pan and grease it with some oil. Pour a ladleful of batter and swirl to spread evenly and thinly all over the pan. Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes. Fold into half and fold again into half to form a triangle. Make more dosas with the remaining batter in the same way. 
', 'Transfer the dosas onto serving plate and serve hot with green chutney. 
']

Ingredients: Regular tea leaves  1 tablespoon Salt  1/2 teaspoon Baking soda  1 pinch   Sugar   as required Milk  1 1/2 cups Salted jeera biscuits   to serve
Method: ['Mix tea leaves and baking soda in a bowl. ', 'Boil 2 cups water in a small stainless steel saucepan, add the tea leaves mixture. Constantly lift ladle full of mixture and pour it back into the pan on medium heat till the colour changes. Add sugar as required and bring the mixture to a boil. ', 'Add milk and again lift ladle full of mixture and pour it back into the pan till colour changes. ', 'Add salt and again lift ladle full of mixture and pour it back into the pan. ', 'Strain the tea into serving cups and serve hot with salted jeera biscuit.']

Ingredients: Baby potatoes , peeled 18-20   Salt   to taste Oil   for deep-frying Yogurt  2 cups Kashmiri red chilli paste  1 tablespoon Green cardamom powder  1/2 teaspoon Dried ginger powder (soonth)  1 teaspoon Fennel seeds (saunf)   1 teaspoon Mustard oil  1 1/2 tablespoons Asafoetida  1/4 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1 teaspoon Clove powder  1/4 teaspoon Garam masala powder  1/2 teaspoon Roasted cumin powder  1/2 teaspoon Fresh coriander sprigs   for garnish
Method: ['Pour sufficient water in a deep bowl and add salt. Prick each baby potato all over with a fork, put in the salted water and soak for 10-15 minutes. Drain and pat-dry with an absorbent paper. ', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Put the baby potatoes into hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper. ', 'Take yogurt in another bowl, add Kashmiri red chilli paste, green cardamom powder, dried ginger powder and fennel powder and mix well. ', 'Heat mustard oil in a deep non-stick pan, add asafetida, red chilli powder and clove powder, mix well and sautÃ© for 30 seconds. ', 'Add Â½ cup water and salt, mix and cook till the mixture comes to a boil. Add yogurt mixture, mix well and cook till the mixture boils.', 'Add fried baby potatoes, mix and cook till the mixture thickens slightly. Add garam masala powder and roasted cumin powder, mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.\n']

Ingredients: Boneless mutton cut into 1 inch pieces 600 grams Oil  1/2 cup Cloves  5   Green cardamoms  4-5   Fennel seeds  1 1/2 tablespoons Medium onions sliced 3   Salt   to taste Ginger-garlic paste  2 tablespoons Fennel powder  5 teaspoons Green cardamom powder  5 teaspoons Kashmiri red chilli powder  2 tablespoons Yogurt whisked 1 cup Roasted chana powder  1/4 cup Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1 tablespoon Ginger cut into thin strips 2 inches + to garnish Fresh coriander sprig   to garnish
Method: ['Heat oil in a pressure cooker, add cloves, green cardamoms, fennel seeds, onions and salt, mix and sautÃ© till well browned. Add ginger-garlic paste, 4 teaspoons fennel powder, 4 teaspoons green cardamom powder and Kashmiri red chilli powder, mix and sautÃ© for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add boneless mutton pieces, mix well and sautÃ© till lightly browned. Add yogurt and mix well and sautÃ© till oil separates.', 'Add 2 cups of water and mix well.  Put the lid of the cooker on and cook under pressure till pressure is released 3-4 times (3-4 whistles) or for around 25 minutes.', 'Open the lid when the pressure reduces completely.  Strain the mixture into a deep non-stick pan through a strainer. Remove the mutton pieces and place on a plate.  Transfer the remaining residue in the strainer into a blender jar, add some of the strained stock and blend till smooth. ', 'Add this to the strained liquid and mix well. Rinse the blender jar with a little water and add to the pan.', 'Keep the pan on heat and bring the mixture to a boil. Mix roasted chana powder with 4 tablespoons water and whisk till smooth. Add this mixture to the mutton gravy and mix well. ', 'Add remaining green cardamom powder, coriander leaves, ginger strips, cinnamon powder and remaining fennel powder, mix well, cover the pan and simmer for 5 minutes.  ', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with ginger strips and a coriander sprig and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Tea leaves     Salt  1/4 teaspoon Cinnamon sticks one inch 2   Green cardamoms  3-4   Star anise  1   Baking soda  1 teaspoon Milk  2 cups Sugar  4 1/2 tablespoons Powdered pistachios for garnish     Dried rose petals for garnish     Cookies to serve
Method:
['Heat 3 cups water in a deep saucepan, add tea leaves, mix well and bring it to a boil.
', 'Add cinnamon stick, green cardamoms and star anise,  mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
', 'Add salt, baking soda and milk and mix well. .
', 'Add sugar and cook till sugar melts. Take the pan off the heat. 
', 'Strain the tea into cups, garnish with powdered pistachios and dried rose petal and serve hot with cookies. 
']

Ingredients: Potatoes peeled 10-12 small Biryani rice Â¾ cooked 3 cups Salt    to taste Oil   for shallow frying Yogurt  2 cups Red chilli powder  2 teaspoons Green cardamom powder  1/2 teaspoon Dried ginger powder (soonth)  1 teaspoon Fennel seed (saunf) powder  1 teaspoon Mustard oil  2 tablespoons Clove powder  1 teaspoon Asafoetida  1/2 teaspoon Garam masala  1 1/2 teaspoon Cumin powder  1/2 teaspoon Saffron soaked in 3 tbsps milk  a pinch Fresh coriander leaves chopped + garnish 2 tablespoons Fresh mint leaves chopped + garnish 2 tablespoons Ginger cut into thin strips + garnish 1 inch Raita   to serve
Method:
['Take sufficient water in a bowl, add  salt and mix well. Prick the potatoes all over with a toothpick and soak them in this bowl. Keep aside for 15 minutes. Drain and place them on an absorbent paper and wipe dry.
', 'Heat sufficient oil in deep non-stick pan, add the potatoes shallow-fry the potatoes on medium heat till golden and crisp. Drain on  absorbent paper
', 'Take yogurt in a bowl, add  red chilli powder, green cardamom powder, dried ginger powder, fennel powder and salt and whisk well. 
', 'Heat mustard oil in the same pan and till it smokes. Add clove powder and asafetida and mix well. Add yogurt mixture,  mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add 1 cup water, mix well, cover and cook for 1-2 minutes.  
', 'Add potatoes and mix well. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add 1 tsp garam masala powder and cumin powder and mix well. 
', 'Spread the rice on top evenly. Drizzle saffron milk, sprinkle remaining garam masala powder, coriander leaves,  mint leaves and ginger strips.
', 'Cover the pan with 2 layers of aluminum foil and place the lid on. Cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes.
', 'Remove the foil and transfer the biryani into a serving dish. Garnish with coriander leaves,  mint leaves and ginger strips and serve hot  with a raita of your choice
']

Ingredients: Lotus stem diagonally cut into 1 inch pieces 250 grams Lotus stem thinly sliced 50 grams Spinach chopped 1 bunch Oil  2 teaspoons Oil   to deep fry Salt   to taste Mustard oil  2 tablespoons Caraway seeds (shahi jeera)  1 teaspoon Asafoetida  1/4 teaspoon Dried ginger powder (soonth)  1/4 teaspoon Fennel seed (saunf) powder  1/4 teaspoon Black salt (kala namak)   as required Garam masala powder  1/4 teaspoon Red chilli powder   to sprinkle
Method:
['Heat oil in a non-stick kadai, add lotus stems and a pinch of salt, sautÃ© on high heat for 5 minutes or till they turn golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
', 'Heat mustard oil in the same kadai till it begins to smoke. Add caraway seeds, asafoetida, and spinach and mix well. Add salt and a little water and mix. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes or till spinach is cooked.  
', 'Mash the spinach lightly with the spatula. . Add the sauteed lotus stems, dried ginger powder, fennel seeds powder, black salt and Tata Sampann Garam Masala and mix well. 
', 'Reduce heat, add 2 tbsps water, cover and cook   for 5-7 minutes or till they are just done. .
', 'Meanwhile heat sufficient oil in a deep pan, drop in the lotus stem slices and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on  absorbent paper, sprinkle black salt and red chilli powder.
', 'Transfer  nadru palak on a serving plate, garnish with the fried lotus stem and serve hot with rice
']

Ingredients: Rice flour  2 cups Jaggery , chopped 1 cup Ghee  1 tablespoon Fresh coconut , cut into small pieces 1/4 cup Ripe bananas  2   Green cardamom powder  1/2 teaspoon Dried ginger powder  1/2 teaspoon Nutmeg powder  a pinch   Baking soda  1/4 teaspoon Oil   as required
Method: ['Heat a non-stick pan, add jaggery and Â½ cup water and cook, stirring, till jaggery melts. Let  the mixture cool.', 'Heat ghee in another non-stick pan, add coconut pieces and shallow-fry till golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper. ', 'Mash bananas in a mixing bowl with a fork. Add rice flour, green cardamom powder, dried ginger powder, nutmeg powder, baking soda and jaggery syrup. Add 1Â½ cups water and mix till you get a lump free batter. ', 'Add fried coconut pieces, mix well and keep aside for 1 to 2 hours to ferment.', 'Heat a appam chatti, drizzle a little oil in each dent. When the oil is hot reduce heat to medium and pour a tablespoon of batter into each dent.', 'After 2 to 3 minutes, turn the unniappams with a toothpick or satay stick. Cook till the other side  turns golden brown. Drain on an absorbent paper.', 'Arrange the unniappams on a serving platter and serve. ']

Ingredients: Raw rice , washed and soaked for 4-5 hours 1 cup Refined flour (maida)  2 tablespoons Jaggery , chopped 1 1/2 cups Ghee  2 teaspoons Fresh coconut slices  1/3 cup Black sesame seeds  1 tablespoon Green cardamom powder  1 teaspoon Cumin seeds  1/2 teaspoon Dried ginger powder  1/2 teaspoon Nutmeg powder  1/4 teaspoon Salt  a pinch   Soda bicarbonate  1/2 teaspoon Oil   to deep fry
Method: ['Heat a non-stick pan, add jaggery and Â½ cup water and cook, stirring till a thick syrup is formed. Remove the impurities and set aside to cool down.', 'Heat ghee in another non-stick pan, add coconut slices and saute till light brown. ', 'Drain rice and put it in a blender jar, add jaggery syrup and grind to a fine paste. Transfer into a mixing bowl, add refined flour and mix well.', 'Add fried coconut slices, sesame seeds, cardamom powder, cumin seeds, ginger powder, nutmeg powder, salt and soda bicarbonate, mix well. Let the batter rest for 1 hour.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai, pour a ladleful of batter and deep fry on a medium low heat till golden brown in colour. Drain on an absorbent paper. Make more neyyappam with the remaining batter. ', 'Arrange them on a serving platter and serve hot with tea.']

Ingredients: Pressed rice (poha)  1 1/2 cups Jagger 9gur) , grated 3/4 cup Fresh coconut , scraped 1 cup Green cardamom powder  1/4 teaspoon Dried ginger powder  1/4 teaspoon White sesame seeds  1 teaspoon
Method: ['Heat a non-stick pan, add jaggery and 2 tablespoons water and cook till you get a syrup of one thread consistency.', 'Add coconut and cook until the mixture is almost dry. ', 'Add pressed rice, green cardamom powder, dried ginger powder and sesame seeds, mix well. Serve']

Ingredients: Boneless mutton , 1 inch cubes, pressure cooked with salt and turm 550 grams Black peppercorns  1 tablespoon Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Coriander powder  1 tablespoon Cinnamon  1 inch   Cloves  5-6   Fennel seeds (saunf)  1 teaspoon Oil  4 tablespoons Mustard seeds  1/2 teaspoon Curry leaves  25-30   Onions , sliced 2 medium Green chillies , diagonally sliced    Ginger-garlic paste  1 tablespoon Dried coconut , cut into thin slices 1/4 cup
Method: ['Strain the mutton pieces and reserve the stock.', 'Dry roast coriander seeds, cinnamon, cloves, fennel seeds and black peppercorns in a non-stick pan till fragrant. Set aside to cool.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick wok, add mustard seeds and when they splutter add curry leaves and onions, mix and saute for 2 minutes. Add green chillies and continue to sautÃ© till onions turn golden.', 'Grind the roasted spices to a powder.', 'Add mutton to the pan with Â¾ cup mutton stock and salt and mix. Add ginger-garlic paste and mix. Add most of the dried coconut slices and mix well. ', 'Add 2 tsps of the roasted spice powder and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot garnished with the remaining dried coconut slices.']

Ingredients: Pomfret , cut into darnes 450 grams Red chilli powder  1 teaspoon Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Coriander seeds   1 teaspoon Dried red chillies  2   Fresh coconut , scraped 3-4 tablespoons Rice , soaked 1 tablespoon Coconut oil  2-3 tablespoons Ginger , chopped 1 teaspoon Onion , finely chopped 1 medium Tamarind pulp  1 teaspoon Coconut milk  2 tablespoons
Method: ['Take pomfret darnes in a large bowl, add red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt and mix well. Keep aside to marinate.', 'Heat a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and coriander seeds and dry roast till fragrant. Cool and transfer into a mixer jar.', 'Add dried red chillies, coconut, soaked rice and some water and grind to a smooth paste.', 'Heat coconut oil in a deep non-stick pan, add ginger and onions and sautÃ© till onions turn light golden in colour.', 'Add the ground paste, salt and 2 cups of water and mix well. Let the mixture come to a boil.', 'Add the marinated fish pieces, a little salt and tamarind pulp, mix well and simmer for 4-5 minutes.', 'Add coconut milk, mix and bring to a boil. Turn the heat off.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl serve hot with steamed rice.']

Ingredients: Refined flour (maida)  2 cups Salt   to taste Ghee  2 tablespoons Oil   for deep-frying Stuffing     Semolina (rawa/suji)  1/2  cup Jaggery (gur) , grated 3/4 cup Fresh coconut , scraped 1/2 cup Green cardamom powder  1/4 teaspoon
Method: ['Take flour in a bowl, add salt, ghee and sufficient water and knead into a soft dough. Cover with damp muslin cloth and set aside for 2 hours.', 'To prepare stuffing, boil 1 cup water in a non-stick pan. Add semolina gradually, whisk and cook till the water is absorbed and the semolina is cooked.', 'Add jaggery, mix and cook till it melts. Add coconut and green cardamom powder and mix well. Transfer into a bowl and let it cool.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions. Shape each portion into a katori, stuff it with some stuffing, bring the edges together, seal and shape into balls. Further roll out each stuffed ball into a thick disc.', 'Slide each stuffed disc into hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and puffs up. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange them on a serving platter and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Mutton cut into 2 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams Fennel seeds (saunf)  2 tablespoons Coriander seeds  3 tablespoons Cinnamon  1 inch stick Star anise  1   Black cardamoms  2   Mustard oil  3 tablespoons Bay leaves  2   Green cardamoms  2   Onions sliced 2 medium Ginger-garlic paste  1 tablespoon Green chillies chopped 1-2   Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Garam masala powder  1/2 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1 1/2 teaspoons Coriander powder  1 tablespoon Salt   to taste coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons Coriander sprig   to garnish Steamed rice   to serve
Method: ['Put fennel seeds, coriander seeds, cinnamon, star anise and black cardamoms on a piece of muslin cloth, bring the edges together and tie into a potli.', 'Heat mustard oil in a deep handi till it smokes. Reduce heat, add bay leaves, green cardamoms and onions, mix and sautÃ© till golden brown.', 'Add ginger-garlic paste and green chillies, mix and sautÃ© for 1-2 minutes or till raw smells disappear. Add mutton and the spice potli, mix well and sautÃ© on high heat for 5-7 minutes.', 'Add turmeric powder, garam masala powder, red chilli powder, coriander powder and salt, mix well and saute for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add 2 cups water and coriander leaves, mix, cover the handi and cook for 35-40 minutes. ', 'Transfer the korma into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot with steamed rice.']

Ingredients: Gram flour (besan)  3 cups Clove powder  2 teaspoons Garam masala powder  1/2 teaspoon Carom seeds (ajwain)  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Hot oil  4 tablespoons Oil  2 tablespo to deep fry
Method: ['Take gram flour in a bowl, add, clove powder, garam masala powder, carom seeds, salt and hot oil. Add sufficient water and knead to a soft dough. Add 2 tbsps oil and knead again. ', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Grease a chakli press fitted with sev stencil with oil, put a portion of the dough in it. Screw on the lid and press the sev directly into hot oil and deep-fry till light golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper and set aside to cool. Make more sev with the remaining dough.', 'Transfer onto serving plate, crush and serve.']

Ingredients: Rice flour  1/2 cup Cooked rice mashed 1/3 cup Salt   to taste Oil  2 tablespoons Ginger chopped 1/2 inch White sesame seeds  1 teaspoon Garlic cloves chopped 2-3   Green chilli chopped 1   Fresh coriander leaves  2 tablespoons
Method: ['Put rice flour, cooked rice and salt in a bowl, add two tablespoons of warm water, or as required, little by little, and knead into soft but firm dough. Rest for five to ten minutes. ', 'Grease your palms with some oil and shape the mixture into medium sized croquettes.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add ginger, sesame seeds, garlic and green chilli and saute till the seeds sputter.', 'Add the rice croquettes and sautÃ© well for three to four minutes, stirring carefully.', 'Sprinkle a little water and cook, covered, for six to eight minutes or till the faraa is cooked and raw smell disappears.', 'Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot as it is or with green chutney or tomato ketchup.']

Ingredients: Sev hard and thick 1 cup Onion seeds (kalonji)  1/2 teaspoon Oil  1/2 tablespoon Asafoetida  1/4 teaspoon Cloves  2-3   Onion finely chopped 1 medium Green chillies  2   Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Tamarind pulp  1 teaspoon Grated jaggery  2 teaspoons Fresh coriander sprigs  7-8   Green capsicum strips   for garnishing
Method: ['Heat oil in a Wonderchef Granite Frying Pan, add asafoetida, onion seeds, cloves and onion, mix and sautÃ© till the onion is lightly browned.', 'Finely chop green chillies and add along with Â½ cup water, salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, tamarind pulp and jaggery. Mix well and bring the mixture to a boil.', 'Add sev and mix well. Cook for a minute. ', 'Roughly chop coriander sprigs and add. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with capsicum strips and serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Boneless chicken  cut into thick strips 400 grams Ginger-garlic paste  2 teaspoons Lemon juice  2 teaspoons Salt   to taste Oil  1  tablespoon Cornflour/ corn starch   2 tablespoons Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Garlic paste  2 teaspoons Green capsicums cut into thick strips 2 medium Tomatoes seeded and thick strips 2 medium Onions, sliced thickly 2 medium Tomato puree   6 tablespoons Red chilli powder   1/2 teaspoon Dried fenugreek leaves (kasoori methi), roasted and crushed 1 teaspoon
Method: [' Apply a mixture of ginger-garlic paste, one teaspoon lemon juice and salt over the chicken strips. ', 'Cover and keep in a refrigerator to marinate for ten to fifteen minutes.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Sprinkle cornflour on the marinated chicken strips and mix well so that the chicken pieces are well coated. ', 'Deep-fry, a few at a time, till crisp. Drain on absorbent paper and set aside.', 'Heat one tablespoon oil in a non-stick kadai. Add cumin seeds. ', 'When they begin to change colour, add garlic paste, capsicums, tomatoes and onions and sautÃ© for five to six minutes. ', 'Add the fried chicken strips, tomato puree, salt and red chilli powder. ', 'SautÃ© for two to three minutes or till the chicken begins to stick to the pan.', 'Scrape the chicken off the bottom of the pan and continue to sautÃ© till chicken again begins to stick to the pan.', 'Add one-fourth cup water and stir. ', 'Cook for a minute and stir in the remaining lemon juice and dried fenugreek leaves. Serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Split green gram skinless (dhuli moong dal)  soaked and boiled  1 cup Pressed rice (poha) soaked 1 cup Oil  1/2 tablespoon Mustard seeds   1/2 teaspoon Cumin seeds  1/2 teaspoon Green chilli finely chopped 1   Curry leaves  5-7   Onions chopped 2 medium Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Salt   to taste Sugar   a pinch Fresh coriander chopped 2 tablespoons
Method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds and let them splutter. ', 'Add green chilli and curry leaves and saute for half a minute. ', 'Add onions, turmeric powder and sautÃ© for half a minute.', 'Add green gram and mix well and saute for two minutes. ', 'Add poha and mix well and cook till heated through.', 'Add salt and sugar and mix well. ', 'Serve hot garnished with coriander leaves.']

Ingredients: Medium prawns , peeled and deveined 1 cup Basmati rice , soaked for 20 minutes and drained 1 1/2 cups Fresh coriander leaves  1/4 cup Fresh mint leaves  1/4 cup Green chilli  1   Ghee  1 tablespoon Black peppercorns  5-6   Cinnamon  1 inch   Cloves  7-8   Green cardamoms  3-4   Bay leaf  1   Onion , sliced 1 medium Ginger , roughly chopped 1 inch   Garlic  3-4 cloves Lemon juice  1 tablespoon Salt   to taste Coconut milk  3/4 cup Small roasted papad cones   to garnish
Method: ['Heat ghee in a deep non-stick kadai, add black peppercorns, cinnamon, cloves, green cardamoms and broken bay leaf, mix and sautÃ© till fragrant. Add onion and sautÃ© till it turns golden brown.', 'Meanwhile to prepare green paste, put coriander leaves in a grinder jar, add mint leaves, green chilli, ginger, garlic, lemon juice, salt and a little water and grind to a fine paste.', 'Add green paste to the spices in the kadai and mix well. Saute on high heat till ghee separates. Add soaked rice and mix gently. ', 'Mix 2 cups warm water and coconut milk in a bowl and add the mixture to the rice mixture. Add salt and mix. ', 'Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes on medium heat. Once the mixture comes to a boil, add prawns and mix well. Cover and cook on medium heat for 10-15 minutes.', 'Transfer the pulao into serving glass cups, garnish each with a roasted papad cone and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Fresh spinach leaves , chopped 1 cup Fresh coriander leaves , chopped 2 cups Gram flour (besan  1 cup Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Ginger-green chilli paste  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Dried mango powder (amchur)  1/2 to taste Yogurt  2 tablespoons Oil  2 tsps + to grease Mustard seeds  1/2 teaspoon Asafoetida (hing)  1/4 teaspoon White sesame seeds (safed til)  1 teaspoon Fresh coconut , scraped 1 tbsp + to garnish
Method: ['Heat 4 cups water in a steamer.', 'Take coriander leaves in a mixing bowl, add spinach, gram flour, turmeric powder, ginger green chilli paste, salt, dried mango powder and yogurt and mix well.  Add little water and mix well to make a dropping consistency mixture.', 'Grease a thali with some oil. Transfer the mixture in it and rotate to spread. Tap the thali to level the mixture.', 'Place the thali in the steamer and steam for 12-15 minutes on medium heat.', 'Release the steamed mixture from sides of the thali with a palette knife and invert the thali on the worktop and let it cool slightly. Trim the edges and cut into square wadis.', 'Heat 2 tsps oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add asafoetida, white sesame seeds and wadis and saute on low heat for 2-3 minutes.  Flip and saute till evenly golden brown on both the sides. Add coconut and saute for few seconds. Switch the heat off.', 'Transfer the wadis onto a serving platter, garnish with scraped coconut and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Beetroot , peeled and grated 1 medium Fresh coconut , scraped 2 cups Ghee  1 tbsp _ for greasing Sugar  1 cup Fresh cream  1/2 cup Walnuts   to garnish Powdered sugar  3 tablespoons Green cardamom powder  1/2 teaspoon
Method: ['Grease a barfi tray with some ghee.', 'Heat ghee in a deep non-stick pan, add sugar, coconut and cream and mix well. Cook on medium heat, stirring continuously, for 15-20 minutes.', 'Meanwhile roughly chop walnuts.', 'When mixture begins to leave the pan, add the beetroot and mix well. Add powdered sugar and green cardamom powder, mix well and cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes.', 'Transfer the barfi mixture in the greased tray and spread it evenly. Sprinkle walnuts on top.  Set aside till set and cooled down to room temperature.', 'Cut into rectangular barfis. Insert a coloured ice cream stick in each barfi, arrange them on a serving platter and serve immediately.']

Ingredients: Fresh fenugreek leaves (methi) , chopped 1/2 medium bunch Bhajanee flour  3 cups Salt   to taste Onion , chopped 1 medium Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Ghee   as required Yogurt   to serve
Method: ['Take fenugreek leaves in a bowl, add salt and set aside for 5 minutes.', 'Take bhajnee flour, onion, turmeric powder and salt in a mixing bowl. Squeeze water from the methi leaves and add to the bhajnee mixture. Add sufficient water and knead to medium soft dough.', 'Place a plastic sheet on a worktop and grease it with ghee. Take a big portion of mixture and place it on the sheet.  Apply ghee on another sheet, place it over the mixture and flatten the mixture.  ', 'Heat a non-stick tawa.', 'Place a star shaped cookie cutter over the thalipeeth and cut out stars. Gently remove the cut outs and place them on the heated tawa.  Make a cavity in centre of each star. Pour little ghee into the cavities and shallow fry, turning sides, till evenly cooked and crisp. Make more thalipeeth with the remaining mixture in the same way.', 'Arrange the thalipeeth on a serving platter and serve hot with yogurt.']

Ingredients: Sago (sabudana) ,soaked 1 1/2 cups Chutney     Scraped coconut  1/2 cup coriander leaves  1/2 cup Green chilli  1   Cumin seeds  1/2 teaspoon Roasted peanuts  2 tablespoons Salt   to taste Sweetened Yogurt     Yogurt ,chilled 1/2 cup Powdered sugar  1 1/2 tablespoons Salt   a pinch Vada     Potatoes ,, boiled, peeled and mashed 3 medium Ginger-green chilli paste  2 teaspoons Salt   to taste Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Roasted and crushed peanuts  3/4 cup Lemon  1/2   Oil   to deep fry
Method: ['To make the chutney, put coconut in a mixer jar, add coriander leaves, green chilli, cumin seeds, roasted peanuts, salt and Â¼ cup water and grind to a fine paste. ', 'To make sweetened yogurt, take yogurt in a bowl. Add powdered sugar and salt and mix well.', 'To make the vada mixture, take soaked sago in a large plate. Add potatoes, ginger-green chilli paste, salt, cumin seeds, peanuts and squeeze the juice of lemon and mix till well combined. ', 'Grease your palms with oil, take a portion of the vada mixture, shape it into a ball and slightly flatten it to shape like a vada. ', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Gently slide in the vades into the hot oil and deep fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on an absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot with prepared chutney and sweetened yogurt.  ']

Ingredients: Squids , cleaned and washed 8-10   Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  3/4 teaspoon Lemons  2   Ginger-garlic paste  2 tablespoons Kokum petals  4-5   Red chilli powder  1 tablespoon Rice flour  1/2 cup Oil   to deep fry Green chutney   to serve
Method: ['Slice squids into rings and transfer into a large bowl. Sprinkle salt, and turmeric powder.', 'Halve the lemons, remove seeds and squeeze their juice directly into the bowl and mix well. Add ginger-garlic paste and kokum petals and mix well.', 'Add red chilli powder and mix well. Add rice flour and mix till all the squid rings are well coated. ', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai, drop in the squid rings, one at a time, and deep fry till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Transfer onto a serving plate and serve hot with green chutney.']

Ingredients: King fish darnes  4   Malvani masala powder  1 teaspoon Garlic paste  1 tablespoon Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Tamarind pulp  2 tablespoons Salt   to taste Semolin   for coating Oil   to shallow fry Lemon slices   to garnish Fresh coriander sprigs   to garnish
Method: ['Take garlic paste in a bowl, add malvani masala powder, turmeric powder, tamarind pulp and salt and mix well.', 'Apply this mixture on both sides of the fish darnes and set aside to marinate for 15-20 minutes.', 'Take semolina in a plate, place the fish darnes in it and coat both the sides of darnes well.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a non-stick pan, place the fish darnes in it and shallow fry, turning sides till golden brown on both the sides. Transfer onto a serving plate.', 'Garnish with lemon slices and coriander sprigs and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Lal baug mangoes ripened  4-5 medium Mustard seeds  1 teaspoon Fenugreek seeds (methi dana)  1/2 teaspoon Cumin seeds  3/4 teaspoon Black peppercorns  6-8 teaspoon Coriander seeds  1 teaspoon Dried red chillies  2   Onion sliced 1 small Ginger sliced 1/2 inch Garlic cloves  3-4   Oil  2 tablespoon Curry leaves  8-10   Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Salt   to taste Jaggery (gur)  1 tablespoon Tamarind pulp  1 tablespoon Curry leaves fride  for garnish
Method:
['Tap each mango on a worktop gently to soften tem, remove the eye and squeeze out the mango  into a large bowl and discard the skin. Squeeze the pulp out and discard the pits.
', 'Heat  a shallow non-stick pan, add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds,  cumin seeds,  black peppercorns, coriander seeds, break and add dried red chillies and dry roast till fragrant.
', 'Transfer the spices into a blender jar, add onion, ginger, garlic and a little water and blend into a smooth paste.
', 'Heat oil in a deep pan, add curry leaves and saue for 30 seconds. . Add the  ground paste, mix and sautÃ© for 2 minutes.  
', 'Add turmeric powder and salt and mix well and saute, stirring continuously,  till  oil separates.  
', 'Add the mango pulp and mix well. Rinse the blender jar with 1 cup water and add, mix well, cover and cook till the mixture comes to a boil. 
', 'Add  jaggery and tamarind pulp,  mix well and cook till jaggery melts. .
', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with fried curry leaves and serve hot.
']

Ingredients: Rice flour  1 cup Asafoetida  1/4 teaspoon Cumin seeds  1/4 teaspoon Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Onion  1 small coriander sprig  8-10   Carrot grated 1/4 cup Scraped coconut  2 tablespoons Green chillies finely chopped 2-3   Oil  2 teaspoons Ghee   for drizzling Coconut chutney   to serve Tomato chutney   to serve
Method:
['Heat a non-stick pan, add  1 cup hot water, asafoetida, cumin seeds, salt and turmeric powder,  mix well and let the mixture come to a boil.
', 'Reduce heat, add rice flour and mix till well combined. Switch off the heat, transfer the rice flour mixture into a parat and let it cool slightly.
', 'Finely chop onion and coriander sprigs  and add to the rice flour mixture. Add carrot, coconut and green chillies and knead the mixture. Add oil and knead into a soft dough. Heat a non-stick tawa.
', 'To make each akki roti, place a large plastic sheet on the worktop,  take a portion of the  dough and place it on one side of the sheet. Fold theother side over the dough and press slightly. Further pat it with your fingers into a roti.  
', 'Transfer the roti on the hot tawa and cook for 2-3 minutes. Flip and apply ghee. Flip again and apply ghee on the other side too. Cook, turning sides, till both sides are evenly golden and crisp. 
', 'Transfer the roti onto a serving plate and serve hot with coconut chutney and tomato chutney.
']

Ingredients: Chicken  cut into 2 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams Medium onions quartered 2   Garlic cloves  6-8   Ginger  1 inches Dried red chillies stems removed and seeded 3   Cinnamon  1/2 inch   Cloves  3-4   Coriander seeds  1 tablespoon Black peppercorns  5-6   Salt   to taste Red chilli powder  1 1/2 teaspoons Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Oil  2 tablespoons Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1/2 cup Lemon slice   to garnish Fresh coriander sprig   to garnish
Method: ['Put onions, garlic, finger, red chillies, cinnamon, cloves, coriander seeds, black peppercorns and a little water in a blender jar and blend to a fine paste.', 'Take chicken in a bowl, add this paste, salt, red chilli powder and turmeric powder and mix well. Set aside to marinate for 30-45 minutes.', 'Heat oil in a deep non-stick pan, add the marinated chicken and sautÃ© for 5-6 minutes on high heat, stirring continuously.', 'Add coriander leaves, mix well and sautÃ© for 2-3 minutes on high heat. Cover and cook on medium heat for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with a lemon slice and a coriander sprig and serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Chicken  cut into 2 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams Ginger-garlic pasgte  1 tablespoon Salt    to taste Turmeric powder  1/2 teaspoon Oil  5 tablespoons Dried red chillies  5-6   Coriander seeds  1 tablespoon Black peppercorns  10-12   Fenugreek seeds (methi dana)  1/4 teaspoon Cumin seeds (jeera)  1 teaspoon Medium onions finely chopped 3   Garlic cloves  6-8   Fresh coconut scraped 1/2 cup Garlic  chopped 1 tablespoon Tamarind pulp  1 tablespoon Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1 tablespoon Coconut oil  1 tablespoon Mustard seeds  1 teaspoon Curry leaves  12-16
Method: ['Put chicken pieces in a bowl. Add ginger-garlic paste, salt and turmeric powder, mix and set aside to marinate for 10-15 minutes. ', 'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan. Add dried red chillies and sautÃ© for 30 seconds. Transfer into a bowl.', 'In the same pan, add coriander seeds, peppercorns and fenugreek seeds, mix and sautÃ© for 10 seconds. Transfer into the same bowl.  ', 'Dry roast cumin seeds on low heat till light golden brown. Transfer into the same bowl.  ', 'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in the same non-stick pan. Add 2 chopped onions and sautÃ© till well browned. Add garlic cloves, mix and sautÃ© on medium heat till golden brown. Transfer to the same bowl.  ', 'In the same pan, add coconut and roast till well browned. Transfer to the same bowl and allow the mixture to cool. ', 'Blend the mixture with some water to a smooth paste. ', 'Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a deep non-stick pan. Add chopped garlic and remaining onions, mix and sautÃ© on medium heat till golden brown. ', 'Add marinated chicken pieces, mix and cook on high heat for 5-7 minutes. Add prepared paste, mix well cover and cook for 4-5 minutes. ', 'Rinse the blender jar with 2Â½ cups water and add to the pan, mix and cook for 8-10 minutes. ', 'Add tamarind pulp and coriander leaves, mix, bring to a boil, cover and cook till done. ', 'To prepare tempering, heat coconut oil in a non-stick pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add curry leaves, sautÃ© for few seconds and add the tempering to the chicken curry and mix well. ', 'Serve hot with steamed rice. ']

Ingredients: Medium prawns shelled and deveined 20-24   Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Coconut oil  3 tablespoons Coriander seeds  1 tablespoon Black peppercorns  10-12   Dried red chillies  6-8   Chopped onion  1 tablespoon Rice  1 teaspoon Fresh coconut scraped 1/2 cup Medium onion finely chopped 1   Medium raw mango peeled and cut into wedges 1   Tamarind pulp  1/2 tablespoon Fresh coriander sprig   for garnish
Method: ['Put prawns in a bowl. Add salt and turmeric powder, mix well and set aside to marinate for 15-20 minutes.', 'Heat 1 tablespoon coconut oil in a non-stick pan. Add coriander seeds, peppercorns and red chillies, mix and sautÃ© till fragrant. ', 'Blend together 1 tablespoon chopped onions, rice, coconut and roasted spices with sufficient water to a smooth paste.  ', 'Heat remaining coconut oil in a deep- non-stick pan. Add onion and sautÃ© till lightly browned. ', 'Add marinated prawns and mango, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add prepared paste, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.   ', 'Add sufficient water and mix. Add tamarind pulp and salt, mix well, cover and cook till fully done. ', 'Garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot with red rice.']

Ingredients: Chicken cut into 2 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams Medium raw mango  1   Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Coconut oil  2 tablespoons Fresh coconut scraped 1/2   Dried red chillies  4   Rice  1 teaspoon Medium onion chopped 1   Tata Sampann Chicken Masala sachet  1 (20 gram   Tamarind pulp  2 teaspoons Dried kokum petals  5-6   Fresh coriander sprig   for garnish Cooked red rice   to serve
Method: ['Marinate chicken with salt and turmeric powder.', 'Heat coconut oil in a deep non-stick pan. Add coconut, red chillies, rice, half the chopped onion and half Tata Sampann Chicken Masala and sautÃ© for a few seconds. ', 'Drain and transfer the mixture into a blender jar, add sufficient water and blend to a fine paste.', 'Add remaining onion to the same pan and sautÃ© for 3-4 minutes. ', 'Peel, remove seed and cut half the raw mango into Â½ inch pieces. Cut the unpeeled mango into Â½ inch pieces.', 'Add chicken to the pan, mix and sautÃ© for 2-3 minutes. Add remaining Tata Sampann Chicken Masala and mix well. Add salt, mix and sautÃ© for 3-4 minutes.', 'Add the ground paste and mix well. Add 1 cup water and stir to mix. Add raw mango pieces and mix well.', 'Add tamarind pulp, mix, cover and cook on medium heat for 15-20 minutes. Add kokum petals and mix well.', 'Garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot with red rice. ']

Ingredients: Bhavnagri chillies slit and seeded 6   Oil  1 tablespo to deep fry Potatoes boiled, peeled and mashed 1 cup Red chilli powder  3/4 teaspo to sprinkle Coriander powder  1/2 teaspoon Roasted cumin powder  1/2 teaspoon Garam masala powder  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Gram flour  1 cup Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Baking soda  1/4 teaspoon Chaat masala  1/4 teaspoon
Method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan and add mashed potatoes, stir a little. ', 'Add Â½ teaspoon chilli powder, coriander powder, cumin powder and garam masala. Mix well. ', 'Add salt, mix again and set aside to cool. ', 'Fill the bhavnagri chillies with this mixture. Set aside. ', 'Mix together, gram flour, turmeric powder, salt, baking soda and remaining red chilli powder in a bowl. Add sufficient  water and whisk to make a smooth and lumpless batter of pouring consistency.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. ', 'Dip the stuffed chillies in the gram flour mixture anddeep-fry in hot oil till golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper. ', 'Sprinkle chaat masala and red chilli powder on top and serve warm.']

Ingredients: Papad khichiya, readymade 4   Oil   for deep-frying Butter  Â½ tablespoon Red chilli-garlic chutney  1 tablespoon Green chutney   as required Onion chopped 1 medium Tomato chopped 1 medium Fresh coriander leaves chopped  as required Chaat masala   to sprinkle
Method: ['Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.Deep-fry papads till they puff up. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Heat butter in a non-stick pan. Add red chilli-garlic chutney and sautÃ© for a minute. Transfer into a bowl.', 'Spread some butter-chutney mixture and green chutney on each fried papad. Put some onion, tomato and coriander leaves on top. Sprinkle some chaat masala on top.', 'Serve immediately']

Ingredients: Split red lentils (masoor dal) soaked 1/4 cup Split skinless black gram (dhuli urad dal) soaked 2-3 tablespoons Split pigeon peas (toovar dal) soaked 2-3 tablespoons Split Bengal gram (chana dal)  1/4 cup Split skinless green gram (dhuli moong dal) soaked 1/4 cup Ghee  2 tablespoons Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Coriander powder  1 teaspoon Garam masala powder  1/2 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Dried mango powder  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Lemon juice  2 teaspoons Fresh coriander leaves chopped  1 tablespoon
Method: ['Heat ghee in a non-stick pan and add cumin seeds. Once they begin to change colour, add turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, red chilli powder and dried mango powder and mix well.', 'Add split lentils, split black gram, split Bengal gram and split green gram and mix well. Add two cups water, cover and cook for ten to fifteen minutes on medium heat.', 'Add salt and lemon juice and mix well.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Refined flour (maida)  1 cup Ghee  1 1/2 tablespoons Salt  A pinch +  to taste Oil  1  teaspoon Cumin seeds  1/2 teaspoon Asafoetida  1/4 teaspoon Split skinless green gram (moong dal) soaked 3/4 cup Garam masala powder  1/2 teaspoon Coriander seeds roasted 1 teaspoon Kashmiri dried red chillies roasted 3-4   Dried mango powder  1/4 teaspoon
Method: ['Combine flour, 1 tablespoon ghee and a pinch salt in a bowl. Add sufficient water and knead into a stiff dough.', 'To make the filling, heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan. Add cumin seeds and let the seeds change colour. Add asafoetida, gram and mix well. Add garam masala powder, salt and little water, mix well, cover and cook till fully done.', 'Grind together coriander seeds and red chillies into a coarse powder.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.', 'Add prepared powder, dried mango powder and remaining ghee to the filling and mix well. Let it get heated through. Transfer onto a plate and let it cool.', 'Divide the dough into equal portions. Make a dent in each portion, stuff with a portion of the prepared filling and shape into kachoris.', 'Deep-fry kachorisin hot oil till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Rajasthani lehsun apple chutney  1 tablespoon Gatte steamed and fried 1 cup Basmati rice cooked  3 cups Ghee  1 tablespoon Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Mustard seeds  1 teaspoon Onion sliced 1 large Salt   to taste
Method: ['Heat ghee in a non-stick pan. Add cumin seeds and mustard seeds and let mustard seeds splutter.', 'Add onion and sautÃ© for 2 minutes. Add fried gatte and mix. Add lehsun apple chutney and mix well. Add some water, mix and cook for a minute.', 'Add salt and mix. Add India Gate Basmati Rice, spread it on top of gatte mixture and cook for a minute. Mix well and cook for a minute.', 'Serve hot garnished with spring onion green flower and green chilli flower. ']

Ingredients: Mangodi (moong dal vadis)  1/2 cup Cabbage  3/4 medium Oil  1 tablespoon Asafoetida  1/4 teaspoon Mustard seeds  1/2 teaspoon Curry leaves  8-10   Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Ginger finely chopped 1 teaspoon Green chillies  3   Dried mango powder (amchur)  1/2 teaspoon Frozen green peas  1/4 cup
Method: ['Roughly chop cabbage.', 'Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add asafoetida and mustard seeds and let the seeds splutter.', 'Add curry leaves and sautÃ© for Â½ minute. Add mangodi, mix and sautÃ© for 2 minutes.', 'Add a few drops of water, cover and cook for 2 minutes. ', 'Add cabbage, salt, turmeric powder and ginger, cover and cook for 1 minute. Mix well, cover and cook for Â½ minute.', 'Slit green chillies and add. Mix, cover and cook for 3-4 minutes.', 'Add dried mango powder and mix well. Add green peas, mix well, cover and cook for 5 minutes.', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Minced mutton (keema)  1 cup Eggs , hard boiled and peeled 4   White bread slices  2   Green chillies , chopped 1 teaspoon Fresh mint leaves , chopped 1 1/2 tablespoons Fresh coriander leaves , chopped 2 tablespoons Coriander powder  1 teaspoon Red chilli powder  1 teaspoon Black peppercorns , crushed 1   Roasted cumin powder  1 teaspoon Garam masala powder  1 teaspoon Ginger-garlic paste  1/2 tablespoon Salt rab  to taste Eggs  2   Breadcrumbs  1 1/2 cups Oil   to deep fry Lettuce leaves   to garnish Red cherry tomatoes , halved  to garnish Red cherry leaves whole  to garnish
Method: ['Put mutton in a grinder jar. Trim the edges and break the bread slices into small pieces and add to the grinder jar along with green chilli, mint leaves, coriander leaves, coriander powder, red chilli powder, crushed black peppercorns, roasted cumin powder, garam masala powder,  ginger-garlic paste and salt and grind to a fine paste. Transfer the paste into a bowl.', 'Break eggs into a separate bowl and beat lightly. Take breadcrumbs in another bowl.', 'Take a portion of blended mixture on your palm, place a boiled egg on it and completely coat the egg with the mixture to make kofta. Dampen your hands with little water and smoothen the outer layer. ', 'Roll each kofta in breadcrumbs and shake off excess breadcrumbs. Dip it in egg mixture and coat it with breadcrumbs again and shake off the excess breadcrumbs. Set aside on a plate.  ', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai, gently slide in the koftas and deep-fry, on medium heat, till golden brown.  Drain on an absorbent paper.', 'Spread the lettuce leaves on a serving plate, add halved red cherry tomatoes and arrange nargisi koftas over them and place a whole red cherry tomato in center. Serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Chicken cut into 1 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams Yogurt  1 cup Ginger-garlic-green chilli paste  1 tablespoon Salt   to taste Ghee  2 tablespoons Onion paste  1 cup Coriander powder  1 teaspoon Mace (javitri) powder  1/4 teaspoon Black cardamom powder  1/2 teaspoon Cumin powder  1 teaspoon Cashewnut paste  1/4 cup Fresh coriander sprig   to serve
Method: ['Take yogurt in a mixing bowl, add ginger-garlic-green chilli paste and salt and mix well.  Add chicken pieces, mix and refrigerate to marinate for 1-2 hours. ', 'Heat ghee in a non-stick pan, add onion paste, mix and sautÃ© till lightly browned. ', 'Add coriander powder, mace powder, black cardamom powder, cumin powder and salt, mix and sautÃ© for 1 minute. Add 2 tablespoons water, mix and saute till ghee separates. ', 'Add chicken and mix. Add Â½ cup water, mix well, cover and cook for 2 minutes. Add cashewnut paste, mix well, cover and cook on low heat till the chicken is fully done. ', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with a coriander sprig and serve hot. ']

Ingredients: Boneless chicken cut into 2 inch pieces 500 grams Chicken mince  1/2 cup Cloves  10-12   Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Green cardamoms  5-6   Mace  2 blade Yogurt  1/2 cup Nutmeg powder  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Oil  3-4 tablespoons Medium onions finely chopped 3   Ginger-garlic paste  1 tablespoon Medium tomatoes chopped 2   Red chilli powder  1 teaspoon Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Coriander powder  1 teaspoon Green chillies slit 2   Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1 tablespo to garnish
Method: ['Heat a non-stick pan, add cloves, cumin seeds, cardamoms and mace and dry roast till fragrant. Remove from heat, cool and grind to a fine powder. ', 'Take yogurt in a bowl, add 1 tablespoon prepared spice powder, nutmeg powder and salt and mix well.  Add chicken pieces, mix well and refrigerate to marinate for 1-2 hours. ', 'Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a pressure cooker, add onions and sautÃ© till lightly browned. Add ginger-garlic paste, mix and sautÃ© till the raw smells disappear. Add marinated chicken, mix and cook for 2-3 minutes. ', 'Add tomatoes, mix and cook till they turn soft and pulpy. Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder and coriander powder, mix and cook till the oil separates. ', 'Add chicken mince and mix. Add green chillies, mix and cook for a minute. Add 2 cups water, stir, cover and cook till the pressure is released for 2-3 times. Add coriander leaves and mix well. ', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot. ']

Ingredients: White bread slices  5   Milk (full cream)  1 litre Khoya/mawa  1/4 cup Sugar  1/4 cup Green cardamom powder  1/2 teaspoon Ghee    for deep-frying Sugar (2 cups sugar cooked with 2 cups water till 1 stri 2 cups saffron strands  few + for garnish    Rose water  1 tablespoon Pistachios blanched, peeled and cut into slivers 6-7   Almonds cut into slivers 6-7   Silver warq   for garnish Dried rose petals   for garnish
Method:
['Heat milk in a deep non-stick pan and bring it to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally. Scrape the sides of the pan and add it to the boiling milk. 
', 'Halve the bread slices diagonally into triangles. Heat sufficient ghee in a kadai. Add the bread triangles, 2 at a time, to the hot ghee and deep-fry till golden. 
', 'When the milk is reduced to half its original quantity, add mawa and mix well and simmer till  the milk reduces to Â¼ quantity. Add sugar and mix well. Add  Â¼ tsp green cardamom powder  mix well and simmer for some time. Cool down to room temperature and keep it in the refrigerator to chill. 
', 'Heat sugar syrup in another non-stick pan, add saffron, Â¼ tsp green cardamom powder and rose water, mix well. Take the pan off the heat when the syrup is slightly warm. Dip the fried bread triangles in this  syrup till they soak up the syrup.  Drain them and keep on a plate.
', 'To serve, arrange  the bread triangles on a serving plate, pour  the chilled rabdi over them.  Garnish with pistachios, almonds, saffron strands, silver warq, and  a few dried rose petals and serve immediately.
']

Ingredients: Cumin seeds (jeera)  3 tablespoons Cloves  12-15   Green cardamoms  15-20   Fennel seeds (saunf)  2 tablespoons Black cardamoms  5-6   Mace blades 4-5   Bay leaves  2   Cinnamon  3-4  one-inch pieces Black peppercorns  1 tablespoon Dried red chilllies  5-6   Poppy seeds (khuskhus)  2 tablespoons Nutmeg (jaiphal)  1/2 tablespoon Dried ginger powder (soonth)  1 tablespoon Roasted Bengal gram (daalia) powder  1 tablespoon
Method: ['Dry roast cumin seeds, cloves, green cardamoms, fennel seeds, black cardamoms, mace, bay leaves, cinnamon, peppercorns, red chillies for 1-2 minutes. Add poppy seeds and continue to roast till fragrant. Set aside to cool.', 'Transfer into a grinder jar. Add nutmeg powder, dried ginger powder and roasted Bengal gram powder and grind to a fine powder. ', 'Transfer into a plate and cool down to room temperature.', 'Store in an airtight container to use as and when required. ']

Ingredients: Boneless chicken legs Cut into 1 1/2 inch pieces 400 grams Hung yogurt  1/2 cup Fresh cream  1/2 cup Garlic paste  1/2 tablespoon Green chilli paste  1/2 tablespoon Black peppercorns crushed  to taste Salt   to taste Garam masala powder    a large pinch Cornflour  1  tablespoon Lemon juice  1 tablespoon Oil  1 tablespoon Butter    for brushing Fresh coriander leaves chopped  for garnish Onion rings   to serve Lemon wedges   to serve
Method: ['Whisk together hung yogurt, cream, garlic paste, green chilli paste, crushed peppercorns, salt, garam masala powder, cornflour, lemon juice and oil in a bowl. ', 'Add chicken pieces, mix well and keep the bowl in the refrigerator to marinate for 1-2 hours. ', 'Preheat oven to 180Âº C. ', 'Skewer marinated chicken pieces onto satay sticks and place on a wire rack. Put the rack in the preheated oven, brush with some butter and bake for 12-15 minutes. ', 'Drizzle some aioli on top, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with onion rings and lemon wedges. ']

Ingredients: Cornflour  1 cup Sugar  2 cups Ghee  1/2 cup Cream of tartar  a pinch   Edible food colour  a few drop   Mixed nuts , chopped 1/2 cup Green cardamom powder  a pinch
Method: ['Take cornflour in a bowl and add 1Â½ cups water and whisk well.', 'Heat a non-stick pan, add sugar and Â¾ cup water and let the mixture come to a boil, stirring continuously. Add cornflour mixture, mix well and cook on medium heat.', 'As the mixture thickens, add cream of tartar and mix well, stirring continuously.', 'Add ghee, little by little, stirring continuously, till the mixture starts to leave the sides of the pan.', 'Add food colour, nuts and cardamom powder and mix well. ', 'Pour this mixture into a casserole and set aside to cool. Once cooled cut into squares and serve.']

Ingredients: Sweet chutney     Tamarind pulp  2 tablespoons Dates chopped and soaked overnight 3 tablespoons Jaggery grated and soaked 3 tablespoons Salt   to taste Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Roasted cumin powder  3/4 teaspoon Bhel     Puffed rice (kurmura / murmura)  1 1/2 cups Nylon sev  2 tablespo to garnish Large onion finely chopped 1   Medium potato boiled, peeled and chopped 1   Salt + red chilli powder  3/4 teaspoon Green chutney  2 tablespoons Garlic chutney  2 tablespoons Sweet chutney  2-3 tablespoons Masala dal  1 glass Moong sprouts blanched 2 tablespoons Fresh coriander leaves chopped  to garnish Flat crisp puris   to serve Dahi batata puri     Puffed crisp puris   as required Medium potatoes boiled, peeled and chopepd 2   Moong sprouts blanched 1/4 cup Yogurt (dahi)   as required Green chutney   as required Sweet chutney   as required Salt + red chilli powder   as required Nylon sev   to sprinkle Fresh coriander leaves chopped  to garnish
Method: ['To make the sweet chutney, put tamarind pulp, dates and jaggery into a blender jar. Add a little water that was used to soak dates and jaggery and blend it all together into a smooth puree. Transfer into a bowl, add salt, chilli powder and cumin powder and mix well. ', 'To make bhel, put the puffed rice into a large bowl, add sev, onion, potato, salt and red chilli powder mix and toss well. ', 'Add the green chutney, garlic chutney and 2-3 tbsps sweet chutney and mix well. Add chana dal and sprouts and mix well. ', 'Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish it with sev and coriander leaves and  serve immediately with crisp puris.', 'To make dahi batata puri, make a hole in each puri and arrange them on a serving platter. Fill each puri with some potatoes, and sprouts. Drizzle yogurt, green chutney and sweet chutney. ', 'Sprinkle salt and red chilli powder. Top with  sev and garnish with coriander leaves and serve immediately.']

Ingredients: Chicken mince (keema)  400 grams Green peas blanched 1/2 cup Oil  2 tablespoons Cumin seeds  1/2 teaspoon Large onion chopped 1   Ginger-garlic paste  1 tablespoon Medium tomato chopped 1   Salt   to taste Red chilli powder  1 1/2 teaspoons Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons Garam masala powder  1/2 teaspoon Lemon juice  1 tablespoon Pavs   to serve
Method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and saute till their colour changes. Add onion, mix well and sautÃ© till onion turns golden brown.', 'Add ginger-garlic paste, mix and sautÃ© for 1 minute or till the raw smells disappear. Add tomato and salt, mix well, cover and cook till the mixture is pulpy.', 'Add chicken mince, mix well and sautÃ© on high heat for 4-5 minutes. Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander leaves and green peas and mix well. Cover and cook for 3-4 minutes.', 'Add garam masala powder and lemon juice and mix well. Take the pan off the heat. ', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot with pavs.']

Ingredients: Processed cheese grated 8 tablespoons Medium potatoes boiled, peeled and sliced into roundels 4   White bread slices  4   Brown bread slices  4   Soft butter  12 teaspoo   Green chutney  8 teaspoons Salt   to taste Bombay sandwich masala  1 tablespoons Mixed capsicums cut into thin strips 1/2 cup + to garnish Medium onions peeled and cut into roundels 2   Potato wafers   to serve Carrot flower   to garnish Carrot grated  to garnish Tomato ketchup   to garnish
Method: ['Preheat a sandwich griller.', 'For one sandwich, apply 1 tsp butter on one side of a bread slice and 2 tsp green chutney. Layer 4-5 potato slices and sprinkle salt and some Bombay sandwich masala over them.', 'Layer some strips of mixed capsicums, some halved onion slices and sprinkle some grated cheese. ', 'Apply 1 tsp butter on another white bread slice and place it buttered side down on top of the first slice. Apply 1 tsp butter on top.', 'Repeat the same procedure for remaining white and brown bread slices.', 'Brush some butter on the sandwich griller, place 2 sandwiches on it, close it and grill  for 5 minutes or till brown grill marks appear on both sides of sandwich.', 'Cut each sandwich into 4 triangles and arrange them on a serving platter. Garnish each triangle with a cherry strung on a toothpick. Keep a carrot flower one side, sprinkle some grated carrot over the sandwiches and some mixed capsicum strips and serve them immediately with potato wafers and tomato ketchup. ']

Ingredients: Eggs boiled and peeled 4   Eggs 4    Butter  4 tablespo for toasting Green garlic stalks chopped 4-5   Medium onions chopped 2 + to serve Medium tomatoes chopped 2 + to serve Salt   to taste Red chilli powder  1/2 teaspoon Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Pav bhaji masala  1 tablespoon Coriander powder  1 tablespoon Garam masala powder  1 teaspoon Fresh coriander leaves chopped 4 tablespo to garnish Pavs  8 to serve
Method: ['Heat 4 tbsps butter in a non-stick pan, add green garlic and sautÃ© till golden brown. Add onion, mix and saute for 2-3 minutes or till golden.', 'Add tomatoes and salt, mix and saute till tomatoes are pulpy.', 'Add red chilli powder and turmeric powder and mix well. Add pav bhaji masala, coriander powder and garam masala, mix and continue to saute for 2-3 minutes.', 'Add Â½ cup water and mash the mixture well with a masher. Grate boiled eggs into the pan, add 1 cup water, mix well and cook for a minute.', 'Break eggs into the mixture and mix them till they get scrambled. Add coriander leaves, mix well and take the pan off the heat.', 'Heat butter on a non-stick tawa, place slit pavs and toast for a minute from both sides.', 'Place pavs on serving plates with onion and tomato, transfer the anda ghotala into serving bowls, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Chicken liver (kaleji)  200 grams Oil  2 tablespoons Cumin seeds  1 teaspoon Medium onions chopped 2   Green chillies chopped 2   Ginger-garlic paste  1 tablespoon Medium tomatoes chopped 2   Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Rec chilli powder  1 teaspoon Coriander powder  1 teaspoon Garam masala powder  1 teaspoon Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons Pavs   to serve Ginger cut into thin strips  to serve Fresh coriander sprigs   to garnish
Method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and sautÃ© till their colour changes. Add onions, green chillies and ginger-garlic paste, mix well and saute till onions turn a light brown. Add tomatoes and salt, mix well and saute on medium heat till tomatoes turn pulpy.', 'Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder and coriander powder and mix well. Add garam masala powder and mix. Add Â¼ cup water, mix well and saute on medium heat till oil separates. ', 'Add chicken liver and coriander leaves and mix well. Cover and cook on medium heat for 15-20 minutes.', 'Transfer kaleji fry onto a serving plate, garnish with ginger strips and coriander sprig. Serve hot with pavs.']

Ingredients: Whole wheat flour (atta)  2 cups Semolina (suji)  Â½ cup Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal) soaked for 4 hours and drained 1 cup Oil  3  tablespoons Asafoetida  Â½ teaspoon Ginger-green chilli paste  2 tablespoons Red chilli powder  1 teaspoon Coriander powder  1 tablespoon Roasted cumin powder  1 teaspoon Fennel seed (saunf) powder  2 teaspoons Garam masala powder  Â½ teaspoon Dried mango powder  Â¼  teaspoon Salt   to taste Fresh coriander leaves finely chopped Â¼  cup Oil   to deep fry
Method: ['Grind black gram to a coarse paste with 2 tablespoons water. ', 'Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a non-stick pan. Add asafoetida and sautÃ© for 30 seconds. Add black gram paste and mix well and saute for 2-3 minutes. ', 'Add ginger-green chili paste, chilli powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, fennel powder, garam masala powder, dried mango powder and salt and mix well.Add coriander leaves and mix. Remove from heat, transfer into a parat and set aside to cool.', 'Add flour, semolina and 1tablespoon oil to the cooked mixture and knead into a semi-stiff dough.', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. ', 'Divide the dough into 16 equal portions and roll them into thick puris of 3 inch diameter. ', 'Deep-fry the puris till golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Serve warm.']

Ingredients: Rice paper sheets  4   Dipping sauce     Sweet chilli sauce  1/4 cup Lemon juice  2 tablespoons Fish sauce  1 teaspoon Soy sauce  2 teaspoons Rice vinegar  2 tablespoons Castor sugar  2 teaspoons Filling     Rice vermicelli , soaked in boiling water for 5 minutes and draine 1 cup Fresh mint leaves  2 tablespoons Cucumber , peeled and cut into thin strips 1 small Red capsicum , cut into thin strips 1 small Yellow capsicum , cut into thin strips 1 small Carrot , peeled and cut into thin strips 1 small Spring onion greens , chopped 2 tablespoons Fresh Thai basil leaves  8-10   Tinned pineapple  , cut into thin strips 2 slices Peanuts , roasted and crushed 2 tablespoons
Method: ['To make dipping sauce, take sweet chilli sauce in a bowl, add lemon juice, fish sauce, soy sauce, rice vinegar and castor sugar in a bowl and mix well.', 'Take some hot water in a shallow plate.', 'Cut rice vermicelli into half and drain thoroughly.  ', 'Dip the rice paper rolls in hot water for 5 seconds and spread them on the work top. Arrange some mint leaves at one end.', 'Put rice vermicelli, cucumber, red capsicum, yellow capsicum, carrot, spring onion greens, basil leaves, pineapple and peanuts on top. Fold the edges of the rice roll from both side and tightly roll it from one end to another.', 'Pack them in the tiffin box with dipping sauce.']

Ingredients: White radish , peeled and grated 1 small White radish , peeled and cut into thin strips 1 medium Carrot , peeled and cut into thin strips 1 small Rice flour  1/4 cup Refined flour (maida)  1/2 cup Wheat starch  1/4 cup Salt   to taste Sugar  2 teaspoons Garlic powder  1 teaspoon Onion powder  1 teaspoon White pepper powder  1/4 teaspoon Dried shitake mushrooms , soaked and chopped 3-4   Oil  2 tbsps + to deep fry To serve     Fried chopped garlic   to garnish Spring onion greens , diagonally sliced  to garnish Fresh red chillies , diagonally slicedqq  to garnish Soy-ginger dip   to garnish
Method: ['Boil sufficient water in a deep non-stick pan, add white radish strips and boil for 4 minutes. Drain them and transfer into a bowl of ice cold water.', 'Add carrot strips to the same pan and boil for 4 minutes. Drain them and transfer into another bowl of ice cold water.', 'To make batter, take rice flour, refined flour, and wheat starch in a large bowl. Add grated radish, salt, sugar, garlic powder, onion powder, and white pepper powder and 3 cups water and mix till well combined.', 'Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non-stick pan. Add mushrooms and sautÃ© on high heat for 2-3 minutes. Drain white radish strips and carrot strips and add to the pan and sautÃ© well. Switch off the heat, add the batter and stir immediately to avoid any lump formation.  ', 'Transfer the mixture into a 6â\x80\x9d x 4â\x80\x9d square silicon cake mould and level out the top.', 'Heat sufficient water in a steamer. ', 'Place the cake mould in the steamer and steam for 1 hour 5 minutes. Switch the heat off and allow to rest for 5 minutes.', 'Remove the cake mould from the steamer and allow to cool down to room temperature. Place it in the refrigerator for 6-8 hours or till completely chilled.', 'De-mould the cake and cut into 1 inch thick squares. These are the radish cakes. ', 'Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Gently slide in the squares, a few at a time, and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.', 'Arrange the radish cakes on a serving plate and garnish with fried garlic, spring onion greens and fresh red chillies. Serve hot with soy-ginger dip.']

Ingredients: Beancurd / Tofu  250 grams Black peppercorns crushed 1 tablespo teaspoon Oil  2 tablespoons Salt   to taste Spring onions  4   Ginger grated 1 teaspoon Garlic grated 1  teaspoon Small red capsicums  2   Small yellow capsicums  2   Green capsicums  2   Soy sauce  2-3 teaspoons Cornflour slurry  4 teaspoons
Method: ['Cut beancurd into big cubes. ', 'Heat oil in a non-stick wok, add the beancurd pieces and shallow-fry. Cut spring onion bulbs and a little of the stem into big pieces.', 'Keep turning the beancurd pieces till they are evenly golden on all sides. Drain and place them on a plate.', 'Add spring onions to the oil remaining in the wok. Add ginger and garlic and toss. ', 'Halve all the coloured capsicums and add to the wok and toss. Add salt and soy sauce and toss. Add Â½ cup water, mix and cook for 2 minutes.', 'Add cornflour slurry and mix. Add beancurd and mix and cook for 2 minutes. ', 'Add 1 tbsp freshly crushed black peppercorns, mix well and cook for 2 minutes.', 'Transfer the mixture into a serving bowl, sprinkle 1 tsp freshly black peppercorns on top and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Button mushrooms halved 8-10   Shiitake mushrooms halved 1/4 cup Shimeji mushrooms  1/4 cup Oil  2 tablespoons Garlic chopped 1 tablespoon Spring onion bulbs roughly chopped 2-3   Ginger cut into thin strips 2 teaspoons Oyster sauce  1 tablespoon Soy sauce  1/2 tablespoon Salt   to taste White pepper powder  1 teaspoon Cornflour slurry  1 tablespoon Spring onion greens chopped 1 stalk +  to garnish Vinegar  1 tablespoon Steamed rice  3  cups
Method: ['Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add garlic, spring onion, and 1 teaspoon ginger, mix and sautÃ© till fragrant. ', 'Add all the mushrooms and mix well. ', 'Add oyster sauce and soy sauce and mix well. Add some water and mix well. Add salt and pepper powder and mix well. ', 'Add cornflour slurry and some water and mix well. ', 'Add spring onion greens and mix well. Add vinegar and remaining ginger strips and mix well and cook till the mixture thickens slightly. ', 'Take rice in a serving boil, pour the mushroom mixture over it and serve hot garnished with spring onion greens. ']

Ingredients: Basmati rice boiled 3 cups Yellow squash medium, cut into diamonds 1/2   Green zucchini medium, cut into diamonds 1/2   Carrot medium, peeled and cut into diamonds 1   Button mushrooms quatered 3-4   Dried shitake mushrooms soaked, drained and halved 4-5   Mixed coloured capsicums cut into triangles 1 cup Oil  2 tablespoons Garlic finely chopped 1 1/2 tablespoons Ginger finely chopped 1 1/2 tablespoons Celery stalk  finely chopped 1 tablespoon Spring onion bulbs diagonally sliced 2-3   Salt to taste     Crushed black peppercorns to taste     Soy sauce  1 teaspoon Red chilli sauce  1 teaspoon Vegetable stock  2 cups Cornflour slurry  4 tablespoons Bokchoy leaves torn 7-8   Spring onion green stalk cut into 1 inch pieces  1 + for garnish
Method: ['Heat oil in a deep non-stick pan, add garlic, ginger, celery and spring onions, mix and sautÃ© for 1-2 minutes.', ' Add yellow squash, green zucchini, carrot, button mushrooms and shitake mushrooms, mix well and sautÃ© for 1-2 minutes.', 'Add mixed capsicums and mix well, Add salt, crushed black peppercorns, soy sauce and red chilli sauce, mix well and saute for 1 minute. ', 'Add vegetable stock,  mix well, cover and cook for 2-3 minutes. ', 'Add cornflour slurry, mix well and cook till the mixture thickens. ', 'Add bok choi and mix. Add basmati rice and mix well. Cook for 1 minute.', 'Add spring onion greens, mix and take the pan off the heat.', 'Transfer the rice into a serving bowl, garnish with spring onion greens and serve hot.']

Ingredients: Boneless chicken breast  1   Salt   to taste Black peppercorns   to taste Lemon juice  1   Oil  1 tablespoon + for deep frying    Spring roll wrappers  2   Romaine lettuce leaves  2-3   Iceberg lettuce leaves  2-3   Chinese cabbage shredded 1/4 cup Carrot peeled and cut into thin strips 1 medium Green capsicum cut into thin strips 1/2 medium Fresh coriander sprigs  4-5   Fresh mint sprigs  4-5   Sweet chilli sauce  1 tablespoon Toasted peanuts  1 tablespoon Fresh mint sprigs   for garnish
Method:
['Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Heat a non-stick grill pan. 
', 'Take chicken breast in a bowl, add salt, pepper powder and juice of Â½ lemon and rub well. 
', 'Add 1 tablespoon oil to the hot grill pan. Place the marinated chicken breast in it and grill, turning sides, till both sides are golden brown and fully done.  Transfer it onto the worktop and let it rest for 5 minutes.  
', 'Meanwhile cut spring roll sheets into thin 3-4 inch long strips,  put them  into hot oil and deep-fry till light golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper. 
', 'Tear romaine lettuce leaves and iceberg lettuce leaves and put them into a mixing bowl.   Add Chinese cabbage, carrot strips, green capsicum strips, coriander sprigs and mint sprigs . 
', 'Thinly slice the grilled chicken breast, add to salad mixture. Add salt, pepper powder, sweet chilli sauce and peanuts and toss well. Squeeze the juice of Â½ lemon and toss well. 
', 'Put the chicken salad in a serving bowl, top with fried spring roll strips and serve garnished with mint leaves. 
']

Ingredients: Rohu fish heads  4   Mustard oil  4 tablespoons Turmeric powder  1 teaspoon Green chillies slit 1-2   Bay leaves  2   Onion finely chopped 1 medium Cumin paste  1 tablespoon Ginger paste  1 tablespoon Garlic paste  1/2 tablespoon Red chilli powder  1 tablespoon Ambe mohor rice soaked for 10-15 minutes 1/2 cup Garam masala powder  1 teaspoon
Method:
['Heat 3 tbsps oil in non-stick kadai till it starts smoking. Meanwhile, take fish heads in a bowl and add salt and Â½ tsp turmeric powder, mix well.
', 'Add the fish heads to the hot oil and shallow-fry, turning sides, till golden brown on both sides.. Drain on  absorbent paper.
', 'Carefully transfer the oil remaining in the kadai into a pressure cooker and add remaining oil and heat till it begins to smoke.
', 'Add green chillies, bay leaves and onion, mix and sautÃ© till onion turns light golden brown.
', 'Add cumin paste, mix and sautÃ© for 1-2 minutes. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and mix well. Add remaining turmeric powder and red chilli powder and mix well.
', 'Reduce the heat and add drained rice and mix well. Add fish heads and mix  well.
', 'Add 1Â½ cups water and garam masala powder. Mix and cover the pressure cooker and cook for 5-10 minutes or till 2 whistles are released. Allow the pressure to be released completely.
', 'Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.
']

Ingredients: Rohu fish  4   Onion medium, sliced 1   Green chillies chopped 2   Salt to taste     Mustardoil  2 teaspoons
Method:
['Heat a non-stick grill pan, place the fish darnes in it and grill on medium heat, turning sides, for 10-15 minutes  Transfer them onto a plate.
', 'Break the darnes into small pieces and put into a bowl after, removing  the bones. 
', 'Add onion, green chillies, salt and mustard oil and mix well.
Transfer into a serving bowl and serve with rice and dal.  
']

Ingredients: Split red lentils (masoor dal) soaked for Â½ hour and drained 1/4 cup Split black gram with skin (chilkewali urad dal) soaked for Â½ hour and drained 1/4 cup Split skinless green gram (dhuli moong dal) soaked for Â½ hour and drained 1/4 cup Split pigeon peas (arhar dal) soaked for Â½ hour and drained 1/4 cup Split Bengal gram (chana dal) soaked for Â½ hour and drained 1/4 cup Salt   to taste Turmeric powder  1/4 teaspoon Mustard oil  2 tablespoons Garlic chopped 1 teaspoon Ginger chopped 1/2 teaspoon Onion chopped 2 tablespoons Tomato chopped 2 tablespoons Green chillies slit 2-3   Moong dal papad  1   Fried Kashmiri dried red chilli  1 to garnish Steamed rice   to serve
Method: ['Take all the grams in a pressure cooker, add salt, Â½ tsp turmeric powder and 3Â½ cups water and cook under pressure till 3 whistles are given out.', 'Heat mustard oil in a deep non-stick pan, add garlic and sautÃ© till it turns a light brown. Add ginger, onion, tomato and green chillies, mix and sautÃ© till tomatoes turn pulpy.  Add boiled grams and mix well. Simmer for 5 minutes on low heat. ', 'Roast the moong dal papad on direct flame and set aside to cool. Crush and add into dal mixture and mix well. Switch off heat.', 'Transfer the dal into a serving bowl, garnish with the fried Kashmiri red chilli and serve hot with steamed rice.']

Ingredients: Sago (sabudana)  1/2 cup Watermelon  1/2 small Milk  4 cups Sugar  1/4 cup Green cardamom powder   a pinch Kewra water  1 teaspoon Almonds,blanched and slivered  8-10
Method:
['Wash and soak sago in one and half cups of water for half an hour. Drain and keep aside. Using a Parisienne scoop, scoop out melon balls from watermelon and chill in the refrigerator. ', 'Boil milk in a thick-bottomed pan, add sago and simmer on low heat for four to five minutes till sago is transparent and cooked. 
Add sugar and green cardamom powder and cook further for a minute. Remove from heat.', ' Cool, add kewra water and mix. Bring it to room temperature and then chill in the refrigerator. 
To serve, place melon balls in small cups, pour the sago kheer on top and serve garnished with almond slivers.
']

Ingredients: Bread     Refined flour (maia) , 2 1/2 cups + 1 tbsp + for dusting Instant dry yeast  3 teaspoons Castor sugar  2 teaspoons Olive oil  2 tbsps + for greasing Salt  1 1/4 teaspoons Semolina (rawa / suji)   to sprinkle Egg wash     Egg yolk  1   Yogurt  3-4 teaspoons Salt  a pinch   Extra virgin olive oil  3 teaspoons Sprinkling     White sesame seeds   as required Onion seeds (kalonji)   as required
Method: ['To make the bread, put refined flour in an electric mixing bowl attached with a hook attachment. Add instant dry yeast, castor sugar, 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt and 1Â¼ cups warm water and process for 8-10 minutes or till a soft dough is formed.', 'Dust the worktop with some refined flour, place the dough on it, drizzle remaining oil over it, and knead again and shape it into a ball. ', 'Grease a large bowl with olive oil and place the dough in it. Cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside to prove for 40-45 minutes or till the dough doubles in size.', 'Knock back the dough and lightly knead it again. Divide the dough into 2 equal portions and shape each portion into a ball. Dust the worktop with some refined flour, place each dough ball and roll into a disc with medium thickness. ', 'Dust a baking tray with some semolina and place each disc on it. ', 'Mix together 1 tbsp refined flour with 2 tbsps water in a small bowl. Dip your fingers in it. Leaving Â½ inch space from the edges of the disc, press with your fingertips in a circular motion while to make an inner circle. Dip your fingers into the flour mixture and make diagonal lines in opposite directions to make diamond shapes inside the inner circle. Cover with a damp muslin cloth and set aside to prove for 20-25 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, preheat the oven at 200Âº C.', 'To make the egg wash, take egg yolk in another small bowl. Add yogurt, salt and extra virgin olive oil and mix well.', 'Brush the egg wash over each disc and sprinkle white sesame seeds and onion seeds. Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes. ', 'Bring the breads out of the oven and place on a cooling rack for a few minutes. Serve. ']

Ingredients: Butter , softened 225 grams Eggs , at room temperature 3   Castor sugar  150 grams Vanilla essence  1/2 teaspoon
Method: ['Break the eggs, separate the whites from the yolks and place them in separate  bowls. Add castor sugar to the whites and whisk till well combined. ', 'Bring sufficient water to a boil in a deep pan. Place the bowl with the egg whites-sugar mixture over the pan and let it heat up slightly.', 'Whisk continuously till the mixture turns fluffy and the sugar melts. (Note- the boiling water shouldnâ\x80\x99t touch the surface of the bowl)', 'Transfer the egg whites-sugar mixture into an electric mixing bowl with a whisk attachment. Add vanilla essence and start to whisk the mixture till it cools down to room temperature.', 'Gradually add butter, a little at a time, and whisk continuously till all the butter is well combined and the mixture turns light and fluffy. Transfer this into a bowl. This is Swiss buttercream. Use for icing or piping on cakes. ']

Ingredients: Butter , at room temperature 150 grams Castor sugar  250 grams Dark chocolate , melted 160 grams Eggs , separated 6   Vanilla essence  1 teaspoon Refined flour (maida)  160 grams Apricot jam  1/2 cup Glaze     Castor sugar  180 grams Dark chocolate , chopped 150 grams Garnish     Dark chocolate ganache  for piping
Method: ['Preheat the oven to 150Â° C.', 'Cream together butter and 125 grams castor sugar in an electric mixer till well combined. Add egg yolks, one at a time, and continue to cream till the mixture becomes light and fluffy. Add vanilla essence and mix well.', 'Whisk together egg whites and remaining castor sugar with an electric hand blender till soft peaks are formed.', 'Add melted chocolate to the eggs yolk-butter mixture and mix well. Fold in the egg whites mixture. Sift the flour directly into the mixture and fold in gently.', 'Transfer the mixture into a greased and dusted 6â\x80\x9d round cake tin and bake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes. ', 'Remove the cake out of the oven and allow to cool slightly. De-mould the cake and discard the parchment paper. Place the cake on a cooling rack and allow to cool completely. ', 'Heat the apricot jam in a non-stick pan till it becomes warm.', 'Horizontally halve the cake and apply a thin layer of the warm apricot jam on one half of the cake. Place the other half of the cake on top. Brush the sides of cake with the apricot jam as well.', 'Heat sugar and 150 ml water in a non-stick pan on high heat till the sugar melts and the mixture thickens slightly. Take the pan off the heat and allow to cool slightly. ', 'Gradually add the chopped chocolate to this syrup and mix till the chocolate melts.', 'Drizzle the warm chocolate glaze over the cake and spread it evenly with a palette knife. Keep the cake in the refrigerator till the glaze sets.', 'Transfer the chocolate ganache into a piping bag fitted with a small star nozzle. Pipe out the ganache over the sides of the cake. Pipe the word â\x80\x98Sacherâ\x80\x99 on top of the cake.', 'Keep the cake on a serving platter, slice and serve. ']

Ingredients: Mixed cheese (processed, cheddar, mozzarellla) , grated 1/2 cup Potatoes , peeled 3 large Dried mixed herbs  1 teaspoon Red chilli flakes  1/2 teaspoon Salt   to taste Black peppercorns , crushed 1 teaspoon Refined flour (maida)  1/2 cup Butter  2 teaspoons Fresh parsley sprig   to garnish
Method: ['Grate potatoes on a plate and soak in a bowl of ice cold water for 15-20 minutes. Drain the potatoes thoroughly, put them on a kitchen towel and dab excess water.', 'Transfer into another bowl, add mixed herbs, red chilli flakes, salt, crushed black peppercorns and refined flour and mix well. Divide the potato mixture into two portions.', 'Heat a non-stick pan and spread one portion of the potato mixture on it. Sprinkle cheese evenly on top and spread the remaining potato mixture over the cheese.', 'Add butter and let it cook until crisp and golden in colour. Turn and cook similarly on the other side as well. ', 'Turn it out onto a serving dish, garnish it with parsley sprig and serve hot.']
